Alta is the leader of the organization. She has been working with several women and men to cover the territory of Bas-Limbé (53 sq km) since August 2010. Marie-Rose assists her on the committee board. Bernique coordinates actions in the field. Josette is the delegate of the organization. Nadia takes notes and files documents as the secretary. Adilia is the treasurer and Paulette is the advisor. They are all portrayed in the photo. 

Your contribution will facilitate access to stored seeds even in the coming period of scarcity on the market. This initiative is pre-funded 25% by PADF.

loans.use: To buy 400 pots of peanut seeds, 14 lb chili peppers seeds and 150 pots of beans seeds to facilitate access to farmers

borrowers.first_name: Mouvement Des Femmes En Action Pour Le Developemen

loans.name: Association Reseau Des Amis (Ara)

texts.en:
Cashews are consumed mostly in four forms in Haiti: chicken sauce with cashew nuts, roasted cashew nuts, salted cashew nuts, and sweet shelf cashews. In December 2011, Tinest Delouima had the idea of setting up a social organization to better respond to this basic need in the food industry. As he already enjoyed a good reputation in his community, his company has quickly become popular in the North Department of Haiti–thanks to its toasted cashew nuts. Today, with ever-increasing demand, he needs your contribution to purchase 350 pots of cashew nuts and 100 dozen plastic bags for his members.

Tinest Delouima is the coordinator of the organization. As shown in the picture, Phicio is the treasurer. Jocelyn is his assistant. Rosane is the secretary and Marie Junie is the delegate. By mutual agreement, they applied for a loan through Fonkoze - Zafèn. Sixty percent of the members are female. This initiative will be pre-funded 25% by PADF.

loans.use: To purchase cashews to roast

loans.name: Nawaf

texts.en:
Nawaf is a 24-year-old single man from the city of Nablus. He lives with his parents and six brothers and sisters in a simple house. His father works as a construction worker where he makes an unstable income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Nawaf is a student in a local college where he studies finance. He wants to complete his course of study and find a job to improve the family's living conditions. Nawaf took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Nawaf will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Nawaf appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 52 años y continua viviendo en alquiler junto con su mamá,  ocupando tres habitaciones incluyendo su cocina y baño, en un acabado de adobe y tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.

Alejandro ha terminado sus estudios en derecho pero continúa trabajando como  profesor de computación en dos colegios donde percibe un sueldo mínimo con el cual cubre los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos, pago de alquiler de la vivienda que habita

Alejandro es la unica persona que gana dinero en su casa y quiere un prestamo para pagar los tramites su titulación, puesto que el tramite es largo y cuesta bastante dinero, ya que lo que Alejandro quiere es poder trabajar oficialmente como abogado, aunque le gusta trabajar con niños en los colegios donde enseña computacion En la foto Alejandro aparece en su humilde hogar
texts.en:
Alejandro is 52 years old and is still living in a rented home with his mother, occupying three rooms including his kitchen and bathroom. The house is located in the city of La Paz and has an adobe and dirt finish.

Alejandro has finished his studies in law but he is still working as a computer skills teacher in two high schools where he receives a minimal salary that covers his expenses for food, basic services and rent for his home.

Alejandro is the only person in his household who earns money. He would like a loan to pay for his legal certification process, as the process is long and costs quite a bit of money. Alejandro wants to be able to work as attorney officially even though he likes working with children in the high schools where he teaches computer skills. In the photo Alejandro appears in his small home.

loans.use: to pay for his legal certification process

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 22 years old. He is married. He is a farmer and has been farming for three years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for growing maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for maize to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has three children, none of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Christine operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, including oranges and bananas, and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits like oranges and bananas, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 34 años de edad, está soltera y vive con su madre y una hermana. 

Vilma, estudió enfermería, pero actualmente no trabaja a tiempo completo, debido a la situación de nuestro país, existen altos indices de desempleo.- Vilma, desea obtener un trabajo adecuado a su carrera, 

Actualmente, obtiene ingresos de algunos trabajos pequeños que realiza y con eso aporta para cubrir algunas necesidades del hogar. 

Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar una ternera, para poder engordarla y luego venderla.- De esta manera, Vilma espera obtener ganancias a mediano plazo.

Ella desea tener un trabajo, donde pueda realizar su sueño de ayudar a los demás por su carrera, y también, poder construir una casa propia, para cuando tenga su propia familia.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 34, is single and lives with her mother and sister. Vilma studied nursing, but due to high level of unemployment in the country, she isn't working full-time. She'd like to get a job suited to her training.

Currently, she gets some income from other small jobs that she does and these are enough to cover her household expenses. She will invest this loan in buying a heifer to fatten and later sell. This is one way she plans to earn money over the medium term.

Vilma wants to get a job where she can realize her dream of helping others with her career.  She also wants to build her own home where she can have a family of her own.

loans.use: buy a heifer for fattening and sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jugos,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere tener una cafetin,el sueño de la socia es que terminen de estudiar sus hijos y que sean profesionales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar papayas,manzanas y naranjas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to work selling juices. Through this business she wants to have a cafe  Her dream is that her children finish studying and get professional jobs.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy papayas, apples, and oranges.  She is glad for the loan and promises to make all of her payments.

loans.use: To buy papayas, apples, and oranges.

loans.name: Felinas Group

texts.es:
Felinas es el nombre del grupo conformado por 11 personas que trabajan con el firme propósito de apoyar en los gastos del hogar para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Los integrantes son:

Trinidad- Venta De Ropa
Ma. Victoria-Venta De Zapatos
Jessica-Venta De Dulces
Alexis-Venta De Tamales
Amada- Venta De Ropa Y Servicio De Carro Cañero
Claudio-Cría Y Venta De Cerdos
María-Servicio De Farmacia 
Gloria-Venta De Ropa
Luisa-Venta De Tacos
Anayanci-Servicio De Estética
Venancia-Venta De Cosméticos  

Jessica tiene 24 años de edad y ha formado una familia con Adán; su hijo se llama Fernando, tiene 4 años de edad y estudia en el preescolar en la colonia donde viven; para Jessica su familia es lo más importante. Hace dos años ella comenzó a vender dulces y ropa casual por lo que solicitó un préstamo para comprar la mercancía “Los primeros tres meses todo marchó bien, el problema vino después, cuando los clientes dejaron de pagar”. Jessica dejó a un lado la ropa pero continuó con la venta de dulces, las ganancias y los préstamos le han ayudado a seguir comprando cada vez más variedad de caramelos y frituras que coloca en una mesa afuera de su casa. Los fines de semana, Jessica aprovecha los juegos de béisbol y de fútbol en la comunidad para ofrecer su mercancía. Jessica necesita invertir nuevamente en los dulces que más vende: paletas, chicles, velitas, pulpas, cocadas, chocolates, lunetas, cacahuates, totis, salsa y bolsas ya que las vacaciones se aproximan y es una buena temporada de ventas. “Gracias a los prestamos que me han sido otorgados y el apoyo de mi familia es que hoy continuo con mi actividad. Me gustaría llegar a poner una tiendita en un futuro.”

*Jessica esta detras de su hijo y su sobrino al final de la fila. La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa de la madre de la señora Ma. Victoria.
texts.en:
Felinas is the name of the group which is made up of 11 people who work with the goal of supporting their households to provide a better quality of life to their families. The members are: Trinidad- sells clothing;  Ma. Victoria-sells shoes; Jessica- sells candy; Alexis- sells tamales; Amada- sells clothing and car service;  Claudio- raises and sells pigs; María- a pharmacy; Gloria- sells clothing; Luisa- sells tacos; Anayanci- an esthetician;  Venancia- sells cosmetics.

Jessica is 24 years old and has formed a family with Adán; their son is Fernando and he is 4 years old and attends preschool in the neighborhood where they live. Family is the most important thing to Jessica. Two years ago she started to sell candy and casual clothing which is what she is seeking a loan to buy the merchandise. “The first three months everything went well, the problem came later when the customers stopped paying.” Jessica stopped selling clothing but continued selling candy. The earnings and the loans have helped her continue buying additional varieties of candies and snacks that she places on a table outside her home.  On the weekends, Jessica takes advantage of the soccer and baseball games in her neighborhood to offer her merchandise. Jessica needs a new loan to buy the candies she sells the most: lollipops, gum, coconut candy, Duvalin brand candy, chocolate candies, peanuts, Toti brand snacks, salsa, and bags as vacations are approaching and it is a good season for sales. “Thanks to the loans that I have been awarded and the support from my family, today I continue with my business. I would like to open a small store in the future.” 

Jessica is standing behind her son and her nephew. The photograph was taken in front of Maria Victoria’s mother’s house.

loans.use: to buy lollipops, gum, coconut candy, Duvalin brand candy, chocolate candies, peanuts, Toti brand snacks, salsa, and bags.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

For the past two years, Doris has operated a retail shop selling stationery. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of books, pencils and pens for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of books, pencils and pens for resale.

loans.name: Margarita Adela

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital provincial e igualmente es cabecera cantonal del cantón del mismo nombre. Esta urbe es la primera ciudad establecida en la costa ecuatoriana. En la ciudadela  Los Jazmines de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne un grupo mujeres emprendedoras quienes tienen las ganas de salir adelante con la ayuda y el apoyo que la fundación les brinda.
Doña Margarita tiene 53 años, es casada, ama de casa y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad; su esposo es abogado  y tiene casa propia.
Ella es comerciante de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), tiene dos personas a quienes les paga comisiones por las ventas, también es profesora y percibe un sueldo mensual.
El Crédito que le fue otorgado es para invertir en cosméticos.  Tiene cuatro años realizando los créditos y le gusta el apoyo que recibe y la unión del grupo.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the provincial capital as well as the capital of the canton by the same name. This major city is the first one to have been established on the coast of Ecuador. In the citadel of Los Jazmines in Portoviejo, a group of enterprising women get together wanting to get ahead with the help and support offered by the foundation.

Margarita is 53 years old and married, she is a housewife with three grown children. Her husband is a lawyer and he owns his house.

She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfums, and accessories for ladies). She has two people selling for her on commission. Margarita is also a teacher and she receives a monthly salary.

This loan is to invest in cosmetics. She has been taking out loans for four years, and she likes the support received and the solidarity of the group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine lives in Sisian with her husband, mother-in-law and 13-year-old son Jack. 

Zarine decided to start work as a manicurist, because she couldn't find a stable job and the family needed any source of income for existence. Her husband works locally in Sisian as a driver, but his salary is hardly enough for covering the family’s costs. 

Zarine has also been involved in beekeeping for three years already. She cultivates some haricot and cabbage as well. To be able to enlarge her beekeeping business, Zarine has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to help her with purchasing 20 colonies of bees. 

Zarine is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her son receives a good education for progressing in life. This loan will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to pay for 20 colonies of bees

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik and her husband live in the town of Meghri. For many years, Satik has been working in a local kindergarten. As her husband is retired, he takes care of their family farm. Their farm includes two cows, calves, and a small orchard where different fruit trees are grown (peach, cherry, pomegranate, nuts and apple). 

To be able to enlarge their farm, Satik asks for this loan. She hopes to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Satik’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history

This loan will greatly assist Satik and her husband’s small farm, and they will be able to improve their economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Zhuleta

texts.en:
Zhuleta is an agronomist from Norashen Village. She lives with her 24-year-old son who is an army officer. However, her son's salary is so low that they cannot afford to live based on that salary alone. Therefore, Zhuleta is engaged in horticulture. She keeps small but beautiful orchard near her house, where different fruit trees are grown (peach, apricot, cherry, apple and pear).

Zhuleta sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way and to enlarge her farm, Zhuleta needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase two steers and to buy some forage for the livestock, preparing for the winter. Zhuleta also needs to renovate the barn so that she will be able to keep the livestock in the winter. 

As this is Zhuleta’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Zhuleta relies heavily on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase two steers, to buy some forage for the livestock, and also to renovate the barn to be able to keep the livestock in the winter

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es:
Epifanio es una pieza clave de su pueblo, pues su venta de carbón representa una manera fácil de tener un combustible para cocinar y para diferentes usos que ellos pueden tener a la mano sin necesidad de realizar largos desplazamientos para obtenerlo, su creatividad lo ha llevado a cerrar negocios al por mayor teniendo la oportunidad de hacerse conocer por diferentes comerciantes.
Para dar abasto a sus pedidos Epifanio quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de carbón en grandes cantidades y quedar con capital para comprar una vez vaya desocupando su bodega de almacenamiento.
Su principal sueño es tener una familia con quien compartir sus logros y un descendiente para trasmitirle sus conocimientos y que este siga con su negocio.
texts.en:
Epifanio is a pillar in his community. His charcoal sales represent an easy way for his neighbors to get fuel for cooking and other uses without having to go a long way to get it. His creativity has led him to close various wholesale businesses when he had the opportunity to make himself known to different vendors.

To fill his orders, Epifanio wants to request a loan so that he can buy a large amount of charcoal with capital leftover, and, at the same time, buy a supply location once it's available.

His main goal is to have a family with whom he can share his successes and a descendant to whom he can pass his knowledge, and that way continue his business.

loans.use: buy a large amount of charcoal

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is a maize farmer from Tafida village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Suleiman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Suleiman, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: 7 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El comité “7 de agosto” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní.  Todas las integrantes se dedican a actividades agrícolas, por medio de esas actividades ayudan a su familia. Son de una zona rural que está en crecimiento.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Ursulina, quien se dedica a la cría de animales y la vez vende huevo, queso y otros productos derivados de origen animal. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está luchando por mejorar.
Ursulina pide este préstamo para la compra de queso, huevos y balanceados para poder usar y vender, y de esa manera seguir dando a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida digna. Todas las integrantes agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The 7th August group is made up of various neighbours in the city of Santaní. All of the group members work in agriculture and through these jobs they help their family. They live in a rural area that is growing.

One of the group members renowned for being very enterprising is Ursulina. She raises animals and at the same time sells eggs, cheese and other animal derived products. She is very hardworking and determined and strives to improve herself through effort and sacrifice. 

Ursulina is applying for a loan to buy cheese, eggs and animal feed that she can use and sell so that she can continue to give her family everything they need to live a decent life. 

All of the group members are grateful for the opportunity they have been given that allows them to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy cheese, eggs and animal feed that she can use and sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven  quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, desde hace varios años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el joven vive en casa de un familiar con su padre y su hermano, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas hierro, metal, herramienta etc. ya que le ha ido muy bien en el trabajo en estos últimos meses y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been blurred is 26 years old, and lives in a high risk area. He owns a metal shop where he makes doors, balconies, railings, and other items. He has been engaged in this activity for several years, and the shop is located in his home. He lives in the family home with his father and brother. Since he has done very well at work in recent months, he is requesting another loan to purchase more iron, metal, tools, and other supplies, which will enable him to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase more iron, metal, tools, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una carnicería ubicada en el mercado municipal desde hace varios años, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de carne de res y de cerdo, chorizos, manteca, etc. para poder seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is blurred is 26 years old, and lives in a high risk area. She has owned a butcher’s shop in the town market for several years. The young woman lives in her own home with her lifetime companion and her son. She is requesting the loan to purchase beef and pork, sausages, butter, and other products, which will enable her to continue with her sales and have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase beef and pork, sausages, butter, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, nails, and wire to repair the basin and the roof of her house.

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es: Elba tiene 60 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos educando. Ella tiene una bodega grande en el ofrecer todo tipo de abarrotes productos de limpieza comida para amínales domésticos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de panetones chocolates leches champagne por campaña navideña. Ella cumple la función de tesorera en el grupo  “EL RENACER DE CHACRASANA”. Elba es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste polo negro.Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Zaida en la parte superior derecha. porque no puedo estar presente en la reunión del grupo por motivos laborales.
texts.en: Elsa is 60 years old, she is married and is educating her 3 children. She has a large warehouse where she offers all types of groceries, cleaning products, and food for domestic animals. She will invest the loan in the purchase of Christmas cakes, chocolate, milk and champagne for the Christmas season. She has the function of treasurer in the group “El Renacer de Chacrasana.” Elba is the second person sitting on the right, she is wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy Christmas cakes, milk, chocolate, and champagne.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es: El grupo “ARCO IRIS” esta conformado por socios dedicados a la ganadería y agricultura. Celinda tiene 53 años de edad es viuda con hijos independientes ella se dedica a la crianza de bacas caballos para luego expenderlos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus animales. En el grupo cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Celinda es la tercera persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste buzo negro.Y de la misma manera se encuentra la foto de Lincolls en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunion del grupo por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
The "Arco Iris" group is comprised of members who make a living farming and raising livestock.

Celinda is 53 years old, a widow with independent children. She raises cows and horses to resell. The loan will be used to purchase food for her livestock. In the group Celinda serves as president. 

The group thanks KIVA investors for the loan provided. Roberta is the third person sitting on the left, wearing black pants.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Jenny Lucetty

texts.es:
Es conocida como la ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, Portoviejo se ha convertido en el más importante centro de actividad agrícola y comercial de la provincia de Manabí y base fundamental de su economía, con un clima cálido seco. Este es un grupo de mujeres luchadoras con ganas de salir adelante, emprendedoras  y llenas de virtudes.
La señora Lucetty tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 7 años, estudian en el colegio y escuela, tiene casa propia, el esposo trabaja en una empresa petrolera.
Doña Lucetty es emprendedora, tiene una lavadora  de carros desde hace un año y medio, con esto aporta para sus gastos personales y de la familia, trabaja con dos personas  a quienes les paga un  sueldo mensual, trabaja de lunes a sábados las ocho horas laborables y el domingo medio tiempo.
El crédito que recibió es para invertir en su negocio para pagar deudas adquiridas y comprar materiales (shampoo para carro, cera, equipos de limpieza, etc.). Ella tiene en la Fundación 4 años solicitando los Créditos que le han hecho la vida feliz, le gusta la responsabilidad de sus compañeras  y sobre todo la agilidad al momento de adquirir el crédito.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is known as the city of Royal Tamarinds. It has become the most important center of agricultural and commercial activity in the province of Manabi and primary base of its economy. It has a warm dry climate. 

This is a group of women fighters eager to get ahead, entrepreneurs full of virtues. Lucetty, age 38, is married with 3 children who are 14, 10, and 7 years old and who attend school. She has her own home. Her husband works for an oil company.

Lucetty is an entrepreneur. She has had a car wash business for a year and a half and this provides her personal and family expenses. She works with two people who are paid a monthly salary. She works from Monday to Saturday eight hours a day and half-time on Sunday. 

The loan received is to invest in her business to pay off acquired debts and to buy supplies (car shampoo, wax, cleaning equipment, etc.)

She has been requesting loans through the foundation for 4 years that have made her life happy. She likes the responsibility of her associates and above all she likes the ease of getting a loan.

loans.use: to pay debts and to buy car shampoo, wax, and cleaning equipment.

loans.name: Almelino

texts.es:
Almelino es un hombre que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y optimismo al  lado de sus dos hijos de pequeñas edades, el vive en un lugar muy humilde conocido como Nahuala Sololá, Juan es un hombre, muy comprometido con su familia, con tan solo 31 años de edad, con una visión muy clara de lo que quiere ser en su vida. 

Almelino desde muy temprana edad, le gustaba acompañar a su papá en la venta de bananos en los diferentes lugares de su comunidad. Pues con el pasar de los años él creció con esa mentalidad de seguir trabajando como vendedor de bananos, pues con la experiencia que obtuvo con su papá, ahora él es un vendedor muy reconocido en el mercado el vende al menudeo y por mayor a otros  vendedores de su comunidad.

El anhelo de Almelino,  es conseguir un préstamo, para comprar un lote de terreno, porque el mayor sueño de él es construir su vivienda  y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y su pareja. Almelino se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable y es muy reconocido por su comunidad.
texts.en:
Almelino is a man who works with a lot of effort and optimism alongside his two young children. He lives in a very humble place known as Nahuala Sololá. Juan is only 31 years old but he has a very clear vision of what he wants to be in life. 

Almelino, from a very young age, liked to go with his father selling bananas in the different places in his community. Then, with the passing of the years, he grew up with this mindset to continue working as a banana vendor, with the experience that he got with his father. Now he is a very well-known vendor in the market. He sells retail and in bulk to other vendors in the community.

Almelino's desire is to get a loan, to purchase a plot of land, because his greatest dream is to build a house and in this way give a better life to his children and his partner. Almelino is characterized as being a very responsible man and is well-known by his community.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una mujer muy optimista con todo lo que hace, ella es originaria de la comunidad de San Juan Pabayal, con dos hijas de tan pequeñas edades una de ellas cursa el 3ro. Primaria y la otra por su corta edad aun no asiste a la escuela, Josefa es una mujer casada de 34 años de edad. 

Josefa es profesora, además de ser profesora ella desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de ropa típica en su comunidad y lugares circunvecinos, Josefa empezó este negocio  con el fin de ayudar a su esposo para un pequeño aporte económico a los gastos de su hogar, ella, vende cortes, blusas y fajas, ella se dedica a esta venta y le gusta hacer  ya que en su comunidad la mayor parte de la población luce este traje.

Ella por el momento no cuenta con suficiente capital para invertir más, en el negocio razón por la cual ella está en búsqueda de un préstamo, porque uno de los sueños de Josefa es  que con el incremento de las ventas en un futuro, Josefa pueda construir su propio local en el mercado de su comunidad, ya que por el momento ella es vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
Josefa is a very optimistic person with everything she does. She is a native of the community of San Juan Pabayal. She has two small daughters: one of them is in 3rd grade and the other one is too young to attend school. Josefa is a married 34 year old woman.

Josefa is a teacher, and besides being one, for three years she has worked selling native clothing in her community and nearby villages. She started this business in order to contribute to the family's income. She sells swatches, blouses and girdles. It is an activity that she likes to do because in her community most of the people wear this type of clothing. 

At the moment, she does not have enough capital to invest more in her clothes business. Therefore, she is looking for a loan, because one of her dreams is to build her own store at the community market, since currently she is a street vendor.

loans.use: in her micro and small business.

loans.name: Asosiyasyon Fanm Karenaj (Afak)

texts.en:
AFAK (Asosiyasyon Fanm Karenaj) is an association of women, which was born in 2004. Philona is the leader, and sewing is her main economic activity. Thanks to a grant from an NGO, she opened a sewing shop for making clothes and manufactured products. With twelve simple sewing machines, five electric sewing machines, two simple industrial machines, and several other sewing accessories, Philona has transferred her knowledge to tens of women. On top of that, she teaches cooking to many of them. She is fighting against women's financial dependence. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase four pieces of cloth, one silkscreen, 45 gallons of paint, labels, and a table for serigraph printing. This initiative is pre-funded 25% by PADF.

loans.use: To purchase four pieces of cloth, one silkscreen, 45 gallons of paint, labels, and a table for serigraph printing

loans.name: Aquino Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Aquino Poty se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres rurales. El grupo se formo en la ciudad de Santaní, el mismo está integrado por 19 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. El grupo se formo con el fin de ayudarse mutuamente a mejorar la calidad de vida entre vecinas.
La señora Maria se dedica a la cría de animales como gallinas y chanchos., y por medio de este humilde trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder construir un gallinero y está muy agradecida con la Fundación, para poder seguir con su trabajo y con su sacrificio para poder seguir con su esfuerzo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Aquino Poty comunal bank is in its fifth cycle with the rural women’s committee.  The group was created in the city of Santaní and is comprised of 19 women.  All of them are very hard-working and tenacious.  The group was created in order to help each other improve the quality of life among neighbors.

Maria raises animals like chickens and pigs.  Through this humble work she helps her family and her loved ones.  She is a very hard-working and tenacious woman.

She is asking for this loan to build a chicken coop.  She is very grateful to the foundation for being able to continue with her work and her sacrifice.  She does this in order to be able to continue with her effort to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Kaigoro Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Gladasi is a 38-year-old hard-working married mother of 5 children, aged between 1 and 6 years, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

Gladasi acquired her start-up capital from farming and selling maize, which she used to open a retail shop. She sells general merchandise to people in her village and the surrounding villages. 

Gladasi is a very honest business woman. However, she faces the challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations caused by inflation, making  the cost of commodities very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase beer, soda, sugar, and salt for resale.

In the future Gladasi wishes to become economically secure. She also has the personal goal of building a permanent home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase beer, soda, sugar, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea, de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como jornalero, tienen un hijo que estudia 1er año de bachillerato, con ella solo vive su esposo y su hijo. 

Actualmente Andrea, se dedica a la venta de antojitos como yuca, panes con pollo, frescos naturales, pastelitos y enchiladas. Ella lleva dos meses de haber iniciado con esta actividad.- Por iniciativa propia decidió vender comida, ya que en el pueblo donde vive, no hay comedores formales.- A ella le gusta cocina y eso fue otra de las razones por las cuales decidió optar por este tipo de negocio.

Anteriormente, se dedicaba a trabajar como sastre, pero le ocasionaba dolor en la espalda estar tanto tiempo sentada frente a la máquina de coser y decidió dejar ese oficio. El negocio de comida está en su casa. Y en él se involucra su esposo y su hijo. 

Con este nuevo crédito, pretende comprar pollo, pan francés, sodas, jugos y otros insumos que necesita para el negocio. Esto ayudará para que su negocio crezca y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
 
Los sueños de Andrea son, ampliar su negocio, comprar un terreno junto a su esposo, para construir su propia casa.- Además, quiere  que su hijo se convierta en un profesional y pueda ayudarle económicamente en un futuro.
texts.en:
Andrea, 54, studied up to college and is married.  Her husband makes a living working as a day-laborer.  They have a son who is studying in the first year of college.  Only her husband and son live with her.
Nowadays, Andrea makes a living selling snacks such as yuca, bread with chicken, natural drinks, little cakes, and enchiladas.  She started this activity two months ago.  On her own initiative, she decided to sell food, since in the town where she lives there are no formal restaurants.  She likes to cook and this was another reason for which she decided to opt for this type of business.
Previously she made a living as a tailor, but sitting in front of a sewing machine for a long time caused her back pain and she decided to leave this work.  The food business is in her house and her husband and son are involved in it.
With this new loan, she intends to buy chicken, French bread, sodas, juices, and other supplies that she needs for the business.  This will help her grow her business and allow her to give a better quality of life to her family.
Andrea's dreams are to expand her business and buy a plot of land with her husband in order to construct her own house.  In addition, she wants her son to become a professional and be able to help her economically in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicken, French bread, sodas, juices, and other supplies she needs for the business.

loans.name: Jeyny Lissett

texts.es:
Jeyny es maestra de educacion primaria desde hace ocho años de laborar en dicha profesion, es Soltera, con dos hijos a su cargo a los que le proporciona todo su apoyo para su formacion y desarrollo , los cuales son niños.
Actualmente esta señora se presento a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar su tercer financiamiento el cual lo utilizaria en la Compra de cuatro puertas, tres juegos de ventanas para su vivienda ya que se encuentran en mal estado.  Lo que vendria a prestarle mejores  condicones y nivel de vida en su seno familiar.
texts.en:
Jeyny is a primary school teacher, with eight years of experience in this profession. She is single, with two children in her care, to whom she provides all support for their growth and development; they are boys. 

Currently, this lady comes to the Ceprodel office to ask for her third loan which will be used in the purchase of four doors, three sets of windows, for her house since it is in bad condition. This will bring her to offer better conditions and level of living in her family home.

loans.use: to purchase four doors, three sets of windows for my house since they are in bad condition.

loans.name: Halliru

texts.en: Halliru is a maize farmer from Pampaida Makaranta village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Halliru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Halliru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Halliru, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo tiene 60 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge e hijos. Vive en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Teofilo se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva café variedad catimore con mas de 30 años en el sector. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café, con esto busca incrementar la calidad y rendimiento de su producto para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le generará un incremento en sus ingresos y con esto un aumento en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 60, married, and lives with his wife and children. He lives in the Cañaris district, Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The local population works in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Teofilo works in agriculture. He has cultivated the catimore variety of coffee for 30 years. He has very good personal and work references from the area. He will use this loan to purchase manure and fertilizers for his coffee. With this, he wants to improve the quality and profitability of his product in order to be able to satisfy his clients' needs. This will cause an increase in his income and, with this, an increase in his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis tiene 36 años, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su conviviente y su menor hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de construcción en su distrito, principalmente realiza trabajos con cerámica y madera. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias comerciales y personales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de nuevas herramientas para implementar su negocio, con esto Jose Luis espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 36 years old and in a relationship.  He lives with his life partner and their minor daughter in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  He lives is a community that is devoted to commerce, agriculture, and livestock.

He provides construction services in his district.  He mainly does jobs with tile and wood.  He also raises and sells pigs.  He has experience in the business, and he has very good business and personal references in the area.

The current loan will be used to buy new tools to use in his business.  With this, Jose Luis hopes to offer better service to his customers.  This will allow him to generate greater earnings and to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy new tools to use in his business.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar, de 26 años de edad, es vigilante y estudió hasta 5° grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la situación económica en que vivian sus padres, fue esa razón por la cual, decidio aprender a trabajar para ayudarles en los gastos a sus padres, está acompañado y junto a su esposa tiene un hijo de 2 meses de edad.

Su compañera de vida, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y al cuido de su hijo, mientras que Oscar, trabaja como vigilante desde hace varios años.-Para llegar a su trabajo Oscar, viaja en bicicleta 1 kilometro, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los dias.

El préstamo que está solicitando en la institución, es para comprar una motocicleta, para poder viajar a su trabajo y asi llegar mas temprano.

Oscar, sueña con comprar un carro, y poder darle a su familia mas comodidades en un futuro.
texts.en:
Oscar, 26, works in security. He studied up to fifth grade but didn't continue because of his parents' economic situation. That's why he decided to learn to work to help his parents with the expenses. He's in a relationship, and he and his wife have a two-month-old son. His life partner does the household chores and takes care of their son.

Oscar has worked in security for several years. To get to his job he rides a bike for a mile. His schedule is 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. every day.

The loan he's requesting is to buy a motorcycle to be able to get to his job and arrive earlier.

Oscar dreams of buying a car and being able to give his family more conveniences in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Markus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Michiel and Haruna.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Markus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Markus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu Yahaya

texts.en: Yakubu Yahaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yakubu Yahaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Maryam, Musa and Haruna.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yakubu Yahaya spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a maize farmer from Tudun Doka village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Joshua can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Joshua, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest-time

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado mujeres unidas  está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las expectativas de poder crecer e ir mejorando. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Miguela quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere que ha ido mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella comenta que se dedica a vender comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, y otros, de manera a seguir luchando en su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. This is a new group that has expectations of being able to grow and improve. The members are also participating in the poverty elimination program, which will help them to grow and move forward.

One of the members is Sra. Miguela. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 3 poverty level, which means that her poverty situation is improving. She says that she sells food that she prepares herself. Miguela goes out to sell her food as a street vendor. She is a self-sacrificing and determined woman.

Miguela is requesting a loan so that she can invest in various supplies for preparing her dishes such as vegetables, condiments, and other items. This will help her to continue striving in her enterprise just as before.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, and other supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es residente en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias, la ciudad amurallada, tiene 29 años de edad y se encuentra dedicado a la venta de pescado hace seis años,  él es padre de dos hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad, inició este negocio con un capital otorgado por sus padres y desde entonces él se ha dedicado a esta actividad en la que consigue recursos para el sustento de su familia.  Compra el pescado, el cual es comercializado en sus canecas y exhibido según tipo de pez, sus clientes son los transeúntes del sector quienes reciben un pescado fresco y listo para preparar en sus platillos.  Este tipo de carne es muy saludable y se consume bastante en este sector del país, por lo que  Oscar ha tenido éxito en su negocio, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará nuevos utensilios para trabajar y pescado para comercializar.  Oscar tiene como meta familiar brindarle una educación de calidad a sus hijos y para su negocio abrir un local comercial lo que contribuirá a tener mas estabilidad.
texts.en:
Oscar is a resident of a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias, the Walled City.  He is 29 years old, and he has been selling seafood for 6 years.  He is the father of two children, ages 6 and 10.

He started this business with capital given to him by his parents; and it has been his occupation ever since.  With it, he obtains the resources in order to provide for his family.  He buys the seafood, which is sold in buckets and displayed according to the type of fish.  His customers are passers-by in the area, who get seafood that is fresh and ready to cook.  This is very healthy food that is consumed quite a bit in this area of the country; so Oscar’s business has been successful.

He is currently applying for his first loan with Kiva, and the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it, he will purchase new working utensils, and fish to sell.  

Oscar’s goal for his family is to provide his children with a quality education, and his goal for his business is to open a store, which will give him more stability.

loans.use: to purchase new working utensils and seafood to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina una mujer que supo superar un divorcio de su esposo quien era la persona que llevaba los gastos del hogar, pero gracias a sus habilidades en la confección monto un negocio el cual le falta una maquinaria para salir a flote y es una recubridora tan esencial en el trabajo, por ello solicita un crédito para comprarla y seguir llevando los gastos del hogar aun en la ausencia de su exesposo
texts.en: Luz Marina is woman who was able to get over her divorce and do well again in spite of it being her husband who paid all household expenses. Thanks to her skills in dressmaking, Luz Marina started a business though she needs sewing machines to stay afloat, including an essential interlock sewing machine. In order to buy this machine, Luz Marina is applying for a loan. She can then continue to pay household expenses, even without her husband's help.

loans.use: to buy an interlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Victor and Praise.  

In the past, in order to cover his immediate expenses such as food and clothing, Mohammed would typically have sold his maize soon after harvest, but at low prices. However, now that he is a member, with Babban Gona's support and help from this loan, Mohammed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more. 

When asked, Mohammed spoke of his ambition to use his additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure his children are educated with professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario un hombre soltero de 40 años que todas las mañanas sale a abrir sui local de venta y reparación de relojes, esta actividad ha sido hereda y enseñada por su padre y con mucho orgullo la ejerce.
Buscando mejorar sus ventas y generar el capital suficiente para pagar el arrendamiento de su hogar que por estas épocas subió de precio, Mario le gustaría solicitar un crédito para la compra de relojes y repuestos de ellos pues toda su vida ha ejercido esta actividad y no se ve haciendo otra profesión.
texts.en:
Mario is 40 years old and single. Every morning he goes out to open his stall where he sells and repairs watches. Mario inherited and learned this trade from his father and is proud of his work.

Looking to improve sales and to generate enough income to pay the rent on his home (which has recently increased), Mario would like to apply for a loan in order to buy watches and spare parts for watches. All his life Mario has done this work and he cannot imagine himself doing anything else.

loans.use: to buy watches and spare parts for watches.

loans.name: Leonila Ofelia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela las Orquídeas de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen un  grupo de mujeres de empuje, constructoras de mejores días para su familia y el propio. Con su clima cálido y de gente amable, expertos en gastronomía. 
Aquí vive la señora Leonila, tiene 63 años, es viuda desde hace veinte años y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, vive con una hija que tiene casa propia.
Doña Leonila es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana cinco horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
El crédito otorgado lo utilizara en compra de cosméticos por temporada de navidad, ella lleva 5 años  en el grupo de Crédito y le gusta lo rápido de los créditos y los intereses bajos.
texts.en:
In the citadel of Las Orquídeas in the city of Portoviejo, a group of enterprising women meet. They are the creators of better days for themselves and their families. Theirs is a town of a warm climate, friendly people and experts in gastronomy. 

This is where Leonila lives. She is 63 years old, has been widowed for twenty years and has five adult children. She lives with a daughter who has her own home.

Leonila is a housewife who sells clothing from a catalogue and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories, amongst others) so that she can earn her own living and help out with the household costs. She works five hours a day, three days a week. She sells her products on credit and collects the repayments each week. She has been doing this job for five years and it has been going very well for her. The items she sells most of are perfume and cosmetics.

This loan will be used to buy cosmetics over the Christmas season. She has spent five years with this loan group and she likes it because of the speediness of the loans and the low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Jesus Arley

texts.es:
Gracias a su hermano Jesús puede gozar de su propio negocio y no porque su hermano se lo haya dado, solo lo motivo para que se volviera independiente y manejara sus propios tiempos.
Jesús a sus 20 años es el dueño de una tienda donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar y esto para un joven humilde, de pocos recursos es un gran logro que con base de ahorros y de préstamos finalizo su tienda. 
Dichos prestamos de momento es su principal problema puesto que pagar las deudas es su prioridad y no le queda mucho dinero para abastecer su negocio por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de refrescos, dulces, chocolates, granos y abarrotes para tener suficiente surtido por un tiempo y pagar algunas deudas.
texts.en:
Thanks to his brother, Jesús has his own store. His brother didn't give him the store, but the motivation to become independent and manage his own time.

At 20 years old, Jesús is the owner of a store selling basic goods. For a modest young man with limited resources, it is a great achievement that he managed to complete his store using both savings and loans.

These loans are his main problem at the moment: paying the debt is his priority, which doesn't leave him much money to stock his store. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of soft drinks, candies, chocolates, grains and groceries in order to have a wide enough range of products for a while, and to pay some debts.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of soft drinks, candies, chocolates, grains and groceries for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Eliecer Miguel

texts.es:
Eliecer sale todos los días a atender su negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, actividad a la cual le dedica 8 horas diarias, negocio que heredó de su familia y que aprendió empíricamente, dicho negocio representa la sostenibilidad de su familia y aspira en un futuro tener familia y seguir con la tradición de la ya famosa tienda. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar variedad de productos básicamente productos de aseo personal, productos refrigerados y granos.
texts.en:
Eliecer goes out every day to tend to his business selling products from the family shopping basket.  He devotes eight hours a day to his work.  He supports his family with the business, which he inherited from his family and learned on the job.  He hopes to have a family in the future and keep up the tradition of the now famous store.

Eliecer is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products, mainly personal care products but also refrigerated products and grains.

loans.use: to buy refrigerated products and grains

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
Ana, una mujer del campo, aguerrida, humilde, trabajadora, honesta y de buena disposición, orgullosamente casada, de su matrimonio nacieron 5 hijos y ayuda a su esposo a mantener su extensa familia, con su negocio de producción agropecuaria donde cría cerdos y gallinas actividades complementarias a los cultivos que hace su esposos.
Ana prácticamente ha levantado este negocio sola y de momento se le presenta algunas dificultades para mantener estable su negocio pero para solventarlas necesita un apoyo crediticio para invertir en animales y cuido para alimentarlos, ayúdala a seguir con un negocio tradicional familiar.
texts.en:
Ana is from the country.  She's a brave, modest, hardworking, and honest woman who has a good attitude.  She's proudly married and had five children with her husband.  She helps her husband support her extensive family with her agricultural business.  She raises pigs and chickens, work that complements the crops her husband grows.

Ana has built this business practically on her own.  At the moment she faces some problems in keeping the business stable and needs a loan to resolve them.  She's going to invest in animals as well as feed to nourish them.

Help her continue with her traditional family business.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and feed

loans.name: Faridis Tamar

texts.es:
Faridis es una adorable abuelita, madre de 5 años, campesina con mucho orgullo, ha levantado a su familia gracias a su venta de cerdos y al campo que le ha proporcionado lo suficiente para comer.
Esta actividad fue con la que nació y con la que espera morir, pero el principal inconveniente es que para vender un cerdo primero tiene que alimentarlo y engordarlo y eso lleva un tiempo y ahora como no tiene ventas su capital esta escaso para invertir por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos y cuido para tener raciones suficientes para un periodo de tiempo de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Faridis is an adorable grandmother, the mother of five children, a proud farmworker.  She raised her family thanks to her pig sales and to the fields that have given her what she needs to eat.

She was born into this work and hopes to die with it.  Her main problem is that to sell a pig, first she has to feed and fatten it, which takes some time.  She has no sales now and her investment capital is scarce, so she's requesting a loan to buy pigs and sufficient rations for care for a period of six months.

loans.use: to buy pigs and sufficient rations for care for a period of six months

loans.name: Geovani Alberto

texts.es:
Geovani es un joven soltero de 26 años de edad fanático de las motos, siempre quería estar cerca de una y aprender todo sobre ellas, el destino lo llevo a encontrarse con un vecino quien lo acogió, lo capacito y entreno en la profesión de reparación de motocicletas.
Geovani inspirado por su sentimiento de emprendimiento monto un taller donde opera y ha generado los recursos necesarios para vivir dignamente pero quiere más, aspirar a mejores cosas, mejorar su vivienda, ampliarse tener empleados y para ello necesita invertir en su negocio razón por la cual solicita un crédito para la compra de repuestos y accesorios para motocicleta haciendo ver su taller más vistoso y atractivo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Geovani is a single young man, 26 years old, who is a motorcycle fanatic. He always wanted to be near one and learn everything about them. Destiny brought him to find a neighbor who took him in, trained him, and coached him in the profession of repairing motorcycles. 

Geovani, inspired by his entrepreneurial feelings, opened a shop where he works and it has generated the resources necessary to live with dignity but he wants more. He aspires to better things, to improve his house, expand to have employees, and for this he needs to invest in his business, the reason for which he asks for a loan to purchase motorcycle parts and accessories making his shop more pleasing and attractive for his customers.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first prepay microgrid

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first prepay microgrid

loans.name: Magaji  Ayuba

texts.en: Magaji Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Magaji Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Mika, Shitu and Adamu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Magaji Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Magaji Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Magaji Ayuba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohanna Danbaba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. When asked, Yohanna Danbaba  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He  joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Isuwa, Isiyaka and Adama.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as his children's school fees and uniforms. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Emmanuel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. He is eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest-time.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mahammadu, A'isha and Abubakar.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as his children's school fees and uniforms. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sani spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest-time.

loans.name: Emmanuel Daniel

texts.en:
Emmanuel Daniel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his daughter: Khadija.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as his child's school fees and uniform. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel Daniel can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Emmanuel Daniel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his daughter, eventually hoping to ensure that his daughter is educated and has access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school fees and uniform, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest-time.

loans.name: Alh. Sagiru

texts.en: Alh. Sagiru is a maize farmer from Kankanki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Sagiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Sagiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alh. Sagiru, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Salamatu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

When asked, Salmanu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

texts.en: Safiya Markus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Safiya Markus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for herself and her son Micheil.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Safiya Markus would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Safiya Markus can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Safiya Markus spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her son, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

texts.en: Ibrahim Bako is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim Bako would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim Bako can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrahim Bako is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Moises Isaac

texts.es: Moises de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica  al cultivo  de maiz y frijol, desde hace varios años, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Moises is 39 years of age. He lives in his own home with his mother. He has made a living growing corn and beans for a number of years. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc to continue working.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Amate Group

texts.es:
Dúo Amate
Don Sergio de 35 años de edad empezó su negocio hace cinco años, vendiendo verduras, invirtiendo Q 500.00 y ahora vende refacciones poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio su mayor anhelo es poner un comedor mas grande para tener un mejor ingreso de dinero agradece a dios y su esposa por el apoyo que le han bridado, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras y productos comestibles para elaboracion de comidas.
texts.en: The Dúo Amate group. Sergio is 35 years old. He started his business 5 years ago selling vegetables with a 500 GTQ investment. Now he also sells car parts. Little by little his business has grown. His greatest wish is to open a larger dining room to have greater income. He is grateful to God and his wife for the support he has been given. He is requesting this loan to buy vegetables and food products to make his meals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and food products to make meals.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, de la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como gallinas, pavos, patos, entre otros, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes que brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría(corrales), de esta manera Maruja espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maruja is 40 years old and lives with her son in the district of Pucará, located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The population in this district works in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry as their primary economic activities. 

She works raising and selling small animals such as chickens, turkeys, and ducks among others. She has 4 years of experience in the business and has customers who offer very good personal and work references for him. She has asked for a loan to purchase a greater quantity of animals and also to make repairs and do repairs to where she raises them. 

In this way, Maruja wants to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers, satisfying their tastes and needs which will allow her to increase her earnings and, in this way, improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of animals and to make repairs and do maintenance to the place where she raises them.

loans.name: Sary Yuliana

texts.es:
Sary, a sus 25 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace 1 año se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en su casa y con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas. 

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 7 horas, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo que tenga; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito que solicita en apoyo con la Corporación Interactuar es para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará una máquina recubridora, con la que podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio. 

Sary manifiesta que su mayor desafío es el alto costo de los insumos para trabajar, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Sary, aged 25, is a hard-working and energetic woman; she is always looking for alternatives that allow her to progress.

For the last year, she has been making a living in the field of garment-making. She learned the trade hands-on, and, slowly but surely, she perfected her technique and broadened her knowledge through practice. It was this fact that encouraged her to open her own workshop, for which she adapted a space in her house. She bought her first machines with some savings that she had.

She works alone every day for seven hours, but sometimes she gets help from another person—depending on the amount of work she has. In this way, she has managed to generate enough income to meet the household expenses.

The loan she is requesting—with the support from the Corporación Interactuar—is to strengthen her business as she will use the money to purchase a serger, with which she will streamline the production process, get more contracts, and, thus, make the business more profitable. 

Sary says that her biggest challenge is the high cost of inputs for her business; however, this keeps her motivated to continue offering a better service and to fight to make her dream of having her business accredited a reality, which will allow her to generate employment opportunities and, in turn, improve her quality of life and that of the people who have an impact on the business.

loans.use: to purchase a serger.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 25 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.
Actualmente posee cultivos de mango y naranja, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 2 hijas.
Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.
José manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
El cultivo de José Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
José is a humble and hard-working peasant. He is 25 years old and from a young age learned all about the work done in the fields thanks to the teachings from his father.

José currently has orange and mango crops, the harvest from which are collected and sold at the local market. This work generates enough income for José to support his household and cover basic expenses for his wife and two daughters.

José is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies (manure, pesticides and fertilisers) in bulk. This will allow José to continue looking after his crops and to improve production at his next harvest, result in a higher income for each sale.

José says that his greatest wish is to continue fighting to have financial stability and to provide his family with better living and well-being conditions.

José's crops can grow and thrive with your help!

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, pesticides and fertilisers) in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Jose es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.
