Nencia es una mujer increíble de 64 años de edad, vive sola, sin una persona que la ayude y mantiene sus cultivos, que es un trabajo muy pesado para una mujer y más de su edad. 
Su hogar, sus cultivos todo lo formo ella a base de trabajo y aunque vive humildemente tiene todo para ser feliz. 
Nencia solicita un pequeño apoyo para tener capital de trabajo para dos cosas, una invertir en abonos y pesticidas y guardara una parte para pagar a algún trabajador que usa esporádicamente para realizar los trabajos que humanamente no puede realizar. 
Apoya a esta adorable y trabajadora mujer de la tercera edad que no tiene a nadie más que tú ayuda para seguir ejerciendo la actividad que le da su sustento diario.
texts.en:
Nencia is an incredible woman who is 64 years old. She lives alone with no one to help her maintain her crops; which is very hard work for a woman of her age.

Her home and her crops are both maintained by her work, and although she lives very modestly, she has everything she needs to be happy.

Nencia is requesting a little help to get together some work capital to do two things: invest in manure and pesticides, and to pay for a day laborer whom she uses sporadically to do the work that's not humanly possible for her to do.

Support this adorable, hard-working woman in her old age who has no one else but you to help her, so she can continue the work that provides her with her daily livelihood.

loans.use: buy manure, pesticide and irrigation hoses.

loans.name: Jasur

texts.ru:
Часур молодой и жизнерадостный парень 26 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Со своей семьёй  Часур живёт в небольшом селе. Он очень любит свою семью. Для того, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью несмотря на свою молодость Часур много работает. Часур занимается земледелием. Также как дополнительный доход, Часур имеет от другого вида бизнеса. У него имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает для дальнейшей продажи.
 Но сейчас Часур хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Часур очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Jasur, age 26, is a young man with a positive attitude.  He is married and the father of one child.  He truly loves his family with whom he lives in a small village.  In spite of his young age, Jasur works very hard to provide for his loved ones.  He works in agriculture.  As an additional source of income, he also has another business:  he owns a few head of cattle, which he raises for further resale.

At the moment, Jasur would like to expand his business, particularly his crop farming activity.  However, he currently doesn't have the means to buy seeds for sowing.  For this reason, he has turned to MDO Arvand and requested a loan to buy seeds.  He is looking forward to a positive outcome and thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas y encementando el piso que muestra en la fotografía pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza por so solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, puertas, hierro y pago de mano de obra y así poder vivir mas cómodos y n lo limpio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 41 years old and he lives in his own house with his wife. He has had a store located in his place of residence for three years. He has many customers, especially his neighbors. 

He wants to improve his home by replacing the doors and putting cement on the floor shown in the photograph, but with what he obtains from his sales, he cannot afford it. For that reason, he is asking for a loan in order to buy cement, sand, doors, iron, and to pay for labor. That way he can live more comfortably and cleanly.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, doors, iron, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso es un microempresario que a sus 49 años de edad y casado, tiene el deseo de seguir superándose para continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia, es propietario de una pulpería teniendo diecisiete años de experiencia en este negocio que le ha permitido diversificar y aumentar los productos ofrecidos logrando pagar las cuotas en el tiempo establecido y cubrir los gastos de su familia, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de vitrinas y un estante metálico con el objetivo de ofrecerle a su clientela mayor variedad y vista en los productos que ofrece.
texts.en: Alfonso is a small entrepreneur. He is 49 years old and married with the desire to continue improving himself and improving the lives of his family. He owns a grocery store. He has 17 years of experience in this business which has allowed him to diversify and increase the products he sells. He has paid his bills on time and covers his family expenses. His current loan request is for the purchase of display cases and metal shelving. He has the goal to offer his customers more variety and display the products he offers.

loans.use: to purchase display cases and shelving for his grocery store

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo es un agricultor que desde los 10 años ha estado involucrado en el campo de cultivo de plátano, trabajando con su padre quien le enseño del negocio,  su padre le heredo las tierras que hasta la fecha trabaja y han sido el sustento de su numerosa familia conformada por 3 hijos y su pareja. 
Su aspiración en el futuro es dejarles el negocio a sus hijos para que continúen la tradición platanera que se ha formado en su familia.
Eduardo solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como lo son abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas y larvicidas
texts.en:
Eduardo is a farmer. Since he was 10 years old, he has been involved in growing bananas. He worked with his father who taught him the business. He inherited his lands from his father and has been working to support his large family that consists of his partner and their three children.

His aspiration for the future is to be able to leave his business to his children to continue the tradition of cultivating bananas in his family. 

Eduardo is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, irrigation, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, and larvicides.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs to grow bananas

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Angelica se sigue dedicando  al negocio de venta de comida por las noches, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Angelica continues her business of selling food at night. She makes various dishes like baked chicken, soups, and stir-fried meat. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has been in this business for 8 years, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for a loan in order to buy cooking products like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy cooking products like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршед молодой и жизнерадостный мужчина 38 лет. Он уроженец  кишлака  Ниджани  города Истаравшан  Согдийской области. Он родился  в семье рабочего. Он женат и имеет четвёртых детей . Он с детства увлекался земледелием.    Он имеет в дехканском  хозяйстве «Чамол бобо» 2,0 гектара земли, из них 0,5 гектара винограда и  1,5 гектара для выкрашивания овощей и корма для скотов. Также он занимается животноводством.
Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Хуршед хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Хуршед заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hurshed is a young, good-humored man of 38 years. He is a native of the Nidzhani village of Istaravshan in the Sogdiskoy region. Hurshed was born into a working family. He is married with four children. 

Since childhood he has been interested in farming. He has an orchard on 2.0 hectares of land with .5 hectares for grapes and 1.5 hectares to grow vegetables and cattle feed. 

He also raises cattle, which brings in a good income. Thus Hurshed would like to grow this business by taking a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. He thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Pang Ya Wende De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur SOMIKIMANDE  est le représentant du groupe PANG YA WENDE DE TANGHIN. Marié, il est  père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé à 15 ans et le moins âgé a  05 mois. 04 vont à l’école.
Monsieur  vend des céréales depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il veut s’acheter  02 sacs d’haricots ; 01 et demi sacs de mil rouge ; 01 sac de petit mil.
Monsieur veut épargner ses bénéfices pour  s’acquérir une parcelle. Il ambitionne être un grossiste.
texts.en: Mr. SOMIKIMANDE is the representative of the group PANG YA WENDE DE TANGHIN. A married man, he is the father of six children. The oldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 5 months old. Four go to school. Mr. SOMIKIMANDE has been selling grains for five years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. He wants to purchase 2 sacks of beans, 1½ sacks of red millet, and a sac of pearl millet. He wants to save his profits in order to acquire a parcel of land. His ambition is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase beans, red millet, and pearl millet

loans.name: Ma. Cherrie

texts.en:
Ma. Cherrie is 35 years old. She is from the municipality of Estancia in Iloilo. She is married with two children who are four and six years old. For a year now, she has been engaged in selling home-cooked viands like noodles, sauteed vegetables and fried fish. She also looks after the tricycle business that her husband is driving for additional income. Ma. Cherrie also sells frozen meat products such as sausage, hot dogs, longganisa (Filipino sausage) and bacon. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy frozen meat products like hot dog, longganisa, bacon and rice. 

Ma. Cherrie hopes to expand her little eatery someday and find a better location to increase her customer base. Her income will be for savings, a healthy diet and reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy frozen meat products like hot dogs, longganisa, bacon and rice

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre casado de 42 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Solola, junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos  actualmente todos sus hijos estudian. 

Francisco, es una persona que se esmera cada día, para darle una mejor vida a sus cuatro hijos, él desde hace ocho años viene trabajando como taxista en el lugar donde vive, le gusta realizar ese trabajo ya que ese tipo de trabajo requiere de  muy buenas relaciones sociales, él es muy reconocido en su comunidad por el tipo de servicio que presta. 

 Francisco no es una persona conformista con un solo trabajo, el también trabaja como ayudante de camioneta, transporte que se dedica a viajes colectivos. Pues la idea de Francisco, es darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y el anhelo de él es seguir apoyando a sus hijos a seguir estudiando hasta llegar hacer profesionales.

Francisco anda en busca de un préstamo, ya que necesita hacer algunos arreglos a su taxi, , para que pueda seguir trabajando, con los  ingreso que el obtiene, no es suficiente para cubrir estos gastos, mientras tanto él ahora está ocupado en su segundo trabajo. La meta de Francisco es conseguir el préstamo para arreglar lo más antes posible su taxi. 
Francisco considera que con los dos ingresos pueda pagar el préstamo, y que a largo plazo el puede seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco, 42, lives in the community of Solola, with his wife and four children, who are all studying.

Francisco is a person who works hard every day to give his four children a better life. He's been working as a taxi driver for the last eight years in the area where he lives. He enjoys his work as this type of work requires good public relations. He is well known in his area for the service he provides.

Francisco hasn't conformed to just one job, he also works as an assistant in transportation. He drives many people around in buses. Francisco's idea is to improve his children's quality of life and his goal is to continue supporting his children's studies until they become professionals.

Francisco is looking for a loan as he needs to make some repairs to his taxi so he can continue working. With the income he currently makes, he isn't able to cover the repair costs. Meanwhile, now he's busy in his second job. Francisco's goal is to get a loan as soon as possible so he can repair his taxi.

Francisco considers that with both of his jobs he can pay back his loan and in the future, he'll be able to continue building his house.

loans.use: pay for his car repairs.

loans.name: Gualberto Antonio

texts.es:
Gualberto es un hombre casado, padre de tres hijos  de 12,10 y 6 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria la cual aprendió solo y con la que ha podido hasta el momento generar el sustento de su familia. 
En vista de que quiere ampliarse un poco, Gualberto quiere solicitar un crédito para la preparación de la tierra, comprar semillas, abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas, larvicidas y el total monto es justificado por el alto precio que tienen estos insumos.
texts.en:
Gualberto is a married man. He is the father of three children aged 12,10, and 6 years old. He is dedicated to agricultural activities which he taught himself to do. So far, he has been able to generate income for his family. 

Given that wants to expand a little, Gualberto wants to apply for a loan for preparing his land and purchase seeds, fertilizers, irrigation, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, and larvicides. The total amount is justified because of the high price of these inputs.

loans.use: to prepare his land and purchase expensive agricultural inputs

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ledy Janeth

texts.es: Ledy una mujer de 28 años de edad, madre de un pequeño de 9 años al cual ama y aspira a darle todas las herramientas para que se forme como un profesional en el área que elija, vive en con su pareja e hijo en una casa de madera, aspirando un día poder tener el capital para transformar su casa de madera, en una casa de material (concreto) y como lo hará pues iniciando su negocio de tienda que ubicara en su hogar, para ello solicita un crédito para comprar estanterías, exhibidores, un enfriador, adecuara el espacio y surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, lácteos, refrescos y productos de aseo.
texts.en:
Ledy is a 28-year-old mother of a 9-year-old little son. She loves him and wants to give him all the tools he will needs to train as a professional in the area that he chooses. She lives with her son and her partner is a wooden house. She aspires to one day have the capital to transform her wooden house into a house of concrete. 

She is starting her business which is a store set inside her home. For this, she is requesting a loan to buy shelves, displays, and a cooler. She will adapt the space to sell an assortment of products such as dry goods, groceries, dairy products, soft drinks, and toiletries.

loans.use: to start a store inside her house

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon, 50 years old, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has eight children in total, five are single and three are married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for more than twenty years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day.  

Hon would to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL and she is going to use this loan to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She is thankful to  all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Dukore I Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Dukore I et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 34 ans et est mariée à Nadine, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, savons,…)  depuis  15 ans. 

Il  est à son vingt-et -unième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il   obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d' articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, savons,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jean is part of the group “Dukore I” and lives in Bujumbura. He is 34 years old and married to Nadine, a merchant. Together they have four children, of whom three are students. 

Jean has been a shopkeeper (rice, beans, soaps, …) for fifteen years. 

He is on his 21st Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase many items for his shop (rice, beans, soaps,…) to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase many items for his shop (rice, beans, soaps, …) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is 33 years old and married. She is a mother of two children. She has been running a business selling animals for many years. Nazia earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Qaim

texts.en: Qaim is 40 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Qaim’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Qaim has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Qaim is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Dusangirimizi Group

texts.fr:
Adèle  fait partie du groupe  Dusangimizi et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à Michel, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de  4  à 6 ans, dont  1 étudie.
 
Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot, unité téléphonique,…) depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de riz, haricot ... à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait devenir une commerçante grossiste, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Adèle is part of the group Dusangimizi and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 29 years old and married to Michel, a mason. Together they have three children, from 4 to 6 years old, of whom one is a student.

Adèle has been a shopkeeper (rice, beans, phone minute cards, …) for four years. 

She is on her 3rd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase some rice, beans,… to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to become a wholesale merchant and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans,... to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Kodjo Benjamin

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 28ans, Mr Kodjo Benjamin revend des produits cosmétiques au marché. Il désire un premier prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il désire réinvestir dans l'activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Sa femme est coiffeuse et ils ont 01 enfant de 06ans en charge. Kodjo Benjamin a 10ans d'ancienneté dans l'activité.
texts.en: A young man, 28 years old, Mr. Kodjo Benjamin sells cosmetic products at the market. He would like an initial loan to purchase some merchandise, so as to respond to customer needs. He would like to reinvest in his business and meet the needs of his family. His wife is a hair stylist, and they have a 6-year-old child to support. Kodjo Benjamin has ten years of seniority in this business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Sunnath

texts.en:
Sunnath, 47, is originally from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children who she supports. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. She has been farming for more than twenty years. Apart from her involvement with the agriculture sector, she also runs a store to sell shoes in the market.

During this time, her store is running badly as she has no shoes to fulfill the customers’ demand. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy more shoes to sell. She hopes this loan will help her business go smoothly as well as bringing a decent income for her family. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Muturirwa Group

texts.fr:
David fait partie du groupe  Muturirwa et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de  28 ans . 

Il a fait le commerce de   bière  et de limonade dans son bistrot    depuis  3 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de bière à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir un grand bistrot et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
David is part of the group Muturirwa and lives in Bujumbura. He is 28 years old and unmarried. David has been doing commerce in beer and lemonade in his bistro for three years. 

This is his 1st Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase many cases of beer to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to have a large bistro and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many cases of beer to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es: Leonel es un microempresario emprendedor  tiene la edad de 49 años, casado, es  propietario de un taller de carpintería, este negocio lo impulsó hace siete años luego de haber ahorrado para la compra las maquinarias necesarias y así iniciar este negocio, es primer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento en ADIM para su negocio y lo requiere para la compra de madera como es cedro macho, esto le ayudará a cubrir la demanda de productos como son puertas, ventanas y chineros, se ha propuesto como meta ofrecer productos de calidad esto le permitirá aumentar la clientela, permitiéndole mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Leonel is a small business owner who is 49 years old and married.  He is the owner of a carpenter's workshop.  He was driven to start this business 7 years ago when he had saved enough to buy the necessary equipment and start the business.  This is his first round of financing from ADIM for his business, and he needs it to buy wood such as Royal Mahogany to help him keep up with the demand for his products such as doors, windows, and cupboards. His goal is to offer quality products, allowing him to increase his clientele and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy Royal Mahogany wood in order to increase his production and therefore income, improving the quality of life of his family

loans.name: Iglesia

texts.en:
Iglesia is 49 years old and runs a small business selling vegetables like squash, okra, taro, tomato, mongo beans, carrots, cucumber, cabbage, water spinanch, spring onion, bitter gourd and eggplant. She has been in to this business for 30 years. She lives in Estancia, Iloilo.

Iglesia has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from CEVI, a partner of Kiva, to expand her business. With the loan amount, she would like to buy papaya, squash, pechay, carrots, cabbage, potatoes and limes.

Her income will be for her youngest child who is 15 years old.

loans.use: to buy papaya, squash, pechay, carrots, cabbage, potatoes and limes

loans.name: Divanna

texts.en:
Originally from Tijuana, Mexico, Divanna graduated from the Iberoamericana University with a graphic design degree. Divanna, with the help of her husband, a chef, created a spread that is made out of organic ingredients. They started selling their spreads in a small local farmers' market and other events in Tijuana.  
  
She is a talented graphic designer and has designed most of the artwork for the spreads. Divanna and her husband would like to bring their product to San Diego, so that they can expand their customer base. In order to do this, Divanna needs to produce the spread from a certified commercial kitchen.
 
She struggled to find a good place in the U.S. to start producing, but eventually she was able to find the perfect location to manufacture her spreads. Divanna will use her Kiva loan to secure the lease in a commercial kitchen to prepare her spreads under proper food regulations, so that people on both sides of the border can enjoy her delicious spreads.

loans.use: to secure the lease in a commercial kitchen

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda has always had a very ambitious and entrepreneurial personality.  After working at a flower shop for several years, the owner closed it down, and instead of looking for another job, Fernanda and her sister decided to open their own.  While this venture ultimately did not work out, it provided her with some essential experience in the process of starting a business.  Since that time, she has gone to cosmetology school and graduated from a prominent beauty academy in 2012.

This mother of two initially worked out of her home, doing hair for her friends and family.  She was forced to stop for almost a year due to some heath complications, but now that she is healthy, she is looking to putting a renewed focus on her business.  She is hoping to direct a lot more energy towards working from her home, with the ultimate desire of opening her own salon in the future.

Fernanda will use the loan to purchase the essential equipment and inventory for her business such as a chair, industrial dryer, dyes and colors, product, and some marketing materials.

“I love to make people feel good about themselves and give them confidence to bring out their inner beauty,” Fernanda says. “I am excited to start this new venture and I am extremely grateful to Kiva lenders for helping me get my business up and running.”

loans.use: to purchase the essential equipment and inventory for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, soda, and beer and to repair his side car

loans.name: Relwende Iii De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur SIBIRI  est le représentant du groupe RELWENDE III DE TANGHIN. Marié, il est  père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 10 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 01 va à l’école.
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 04 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il veut s’acheter  03 moutons ; 07 poules.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour la scolarisation de ses enfants. Il ambitionne être un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Mr. SIBIRI is the representative of the group RELWENDE III DE TANGHIN. A married man, he is the father of three children. The oldest is 10 years old, and the youngest is 1. One goes to school. Mr. SIBIRI has been a livestock farmer for four years. He gets his supplies from the market in his district. He wants to purchase 3 sheep and 7 hens. He wants to use his profits for his children’s schooling. His ambition is to be a major livestock farmer.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sheep and 7 hens

loans.name: Guillermo Leon

texts.es:
Como no sonreír, como no ponerse contento si gracias a un crédito Guillermo podrá realizar el sueño de su vida, ser un tendero, ser independiente, en pocas palabras ser su propio jefe, y con orgullo muestra el local que quiere comprar con el monto que está solicitando, él tiene un ahorros y junto con el préstamo abastecerá para iniciar rápidamente con su negocio, buscando sostenibilidad económica en el tiempo para él y su esposa.
Apóyalo no permitas que esa sonrisa se acabe un apoyo puede ayudar a Guillermo a repartir su buenas energías a todo cliente que se acerque a solicitar un producto.
Comprare el local, los implementos del local y surtido en productos de la canasta familiar, granos, abarrotes, víveres refrescos, lácteos, productos refrigerados, frituras, dulces, productos de aseo personal, de aseo domestico etc.
texts.en:
How is he not going to smile! How is Guillermo not going to be happy when with a loan he will be able to realize his life dream: to own a store, to be independent, in a few words, to be his own boss.

He proudly shows the site he wants to buy with this loan. He has some savings, with these and the loan he will get supplies and start business quickly. In time, he will be looking for economic sustainability for himself and his wife.

He will buy the site, the implements, and a stock of basic food basket products including grains, groceries, fresh food, dairy products, fridge items, chips, candy, personal care products, and household cleaning products.

Don't let that smile dim! Your support will help Guillermo to share his good energy with every client that stops by asking for a product.

loans.use: to start his grocery business. He will buy the site shown in the photo and an assortment of basic food products.

loans.name: Novy Carla

texts.en:
Novy Carla is a 38-year-old entrepreneur from Estancia, Iloilo. Novy Carla works hard for her two children ages one and eight.

For the past ten years, Novy Carla has run a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items such as biscuits, chips, soft drinks, and cookies near a school. Novy Carla's store is just a small one, but she would like to make it bigger. 

Novy Carla is asking a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, candies, juice powder, biscuits and soft drinks. Food for the students during snack time is what sells the most. She hopes for her family to experience a progressive life in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, candies, juice powder, biscuits and soft drinks

loans.name: Pengdewende De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
Madame CLEMENTINE est la représentante du groupe PENGDWENDE DE TANGHIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé à 21 ans et le moins âgé à 02 mois. 02 vont à l’école. 
Madame vend des céréales depuis 03 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de petit mil ; 02 sacs d’haricots ; 01 sac d’arachide.
Madame compte utiliser ses bénéfices pour  investir dans con commerce. Elle ambitionne devenir un grossiste.
texts.en: Ms. CLEMENTINE is the representative of the group PENGDWENDE DE TANGHIN. A married woman, she is the mother of seven children. The oldest is 21 years old, and the youngest is 2 months old. Two go to school. Ms. CLEMENTINE has been selling grains for three years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. She wants to purchase 2 sacks of pearl millet, 2 sacks of beans, and a sack of peanuts. She plans on using her profits to invest in her business. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase pearl millet, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Ruth, a hardworking, very honest and warmhearted farmer who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Ruth is the proud mother of one lovely child that she really loves and adores and always protects. Ruth’s upbringing was very challenging and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard and get out of the poverty situation. That is why she started farming 10 years ago and through farming she has been able to earn a decent income. Ruth is the breadwinner in her family and this really pushes her to work hard so that her angel will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Ruth is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming so that she can use the excess space on her land and she dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture farming.

Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Ruth is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change.

Through the income from horticulture farming, Ruth will assure her child of a bright future and she will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 24 years old, and she lives with her parents and brother in Senaki district. 

The only source of income for the family is her father's and brother's monthly salary working as hired workers. Sopio has a great desire to do her part for the family's welfare and to be involved in her own business. 

Sopio requested a loan, but her application was rejected several times for not having enough income or business experience. Sopio's loan request was approved by the start-up program, a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, which gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. 

Sopio plans to purchase clothing stock and other accessories for babies and sell them locally. She will sell products from her house and will be able to generate her own income. The loan will greatly assist Sopio and her family, enabling them to cover daily costs and improve their living conditions. They await your help.

loans.use: to purchase clothing stock and other accessories for babies

loans.name: Karimatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer en décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois. Les membres du groupe habitent le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel, très solidaires entre elles. L’activité principale est le petit commerce et la transformation.

Madame Karimatou (assise  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle s’active dans la vente de pâte d’arachide, pour se faire elle achète les graines fait la transformation puis la vente par seaux de 5 ou 20 kg. Elle jouit d’une bonne connaissance de l’activité.

Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des graines en quantité 02 ou 03 sacs de 50 kilos en vu de la transformation pour la revente.

Les retombées de ses activités lui permettront de mieux assister son époux dans les charges des besoins familiaux : nourriture, santé et éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2008 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The group members live in the same village. They are inspired by mutual support and assistance and have a lot of solidarity among themselves. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and food-processing.

Ms. Karimatou (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is active in selling peanut butter. To do so, she purchases the peanuts, processing them, and then makes her sales by the 5-kg or 20-kg pail. She enjoys good knowledge of this business. 

This loan will enable her to purchase two or three 50-kg sacks of peanuts with the aim of processing them for resale. 

The profits from her work will enable her to do better in helping out her husband to meet family needs:  food, healthcare, and the children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts in 50-kg sacks to process and resell

loans.name: Mayo's Group

texts.fr:
Créer en décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois. Les membres du groupe habitent le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel, très solidaires entre elles. L’activité principale est le petit commerce et la transformation.

Madame Mayo (assise  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans, mariée  et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et un garçon. Elle s’active dans la transformation de produits locaux plus précisément de la pâte d’arachide. Elle achète les graines non décortiquées par sas  de 50 kilos pour les besoins de l’activité.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter au moins 04 sacs de 50 kilos de graines d’arachide non décortiquées pour la transformation et la vente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer une meilleure prise en charge des besoins scolaires des enfants et leur alimentation.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2008 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The group members live in the same village. They are inspired by mutual support and assistance and have a lot of solidarity. 

Ms. Mayo (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of three children (2 girls and a boy). Ms. Mayo is active in processing local products, peanut butter to be exact. She purchases unshelled peanuts by the 50-kg sack for her business. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase at least four 50-kg sacks of unshelled peanuts in order to process and sell. 

The profits will enable her to ensure she does the best in meeting the food and educational needs of the children.

loans.use: to purchase unshelled peanuts to process and sell

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder un floricultor de 33 años de edad, padre y responsable de una familia conformada por su hijo y su pareja, gana el sustento de su familia gracias al campo de flores que le dejo su padre quien le enseño todo sobre el negocio.
Wilder busca con su negocio tener suficientes recursos para darle a su pequeño de 10 años una educación digna. 
Las flores son un ser que necesitan de mucho cuidado, para que crezcan fuertes y no sean devoradas por las múltiples plagas que las acechan y lo curioso es que los insumos para resguardarlas son muy costosos por tal razón Wilder solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas para proteger y hacer que sus flores crezcan fuertes y hermosas.
texts.en:
Wilder, a 33-year-old flower grower, is a father responsible for a family composed of his son and his partner. He earns a living for his family thanks to the field of flowers that he inherited from his father, who taught him everything about the business.

Through his business, Wilder seeks to generate enough money to provide his 10-year-old child with a decent education.

Flowers are beings that need a great deal of care so that they can grow strong and avoid being devoured by the multiple pests that threaten them. What is interesting is that the inputs used to protect them are very expensive. For this reason, Wilder is requesting a loan. He will use it to buy organic fertilizers, pesticides, and fungicides to protect his flowers and make them grow strong and beautiful.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, pesticides, and fungicides to protect his flowers and make them grow strong and beautiful.

loans.name: Gelen Del Carmen

texts.es: Gelen  es una joven emprendedora que tiene la edad de 24 años, casada y propietaria de una pulpería desde hace tres años, es el cuarto ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con las cuotas de pago, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de un estante metálico, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor vista de los productos ofrecidos y así atraer mayor clientela.
texts.en: Gelen is a young entrepreneur who is 24 years old, married, and has owned a convenience store for three years.  This is the third loan cycle in which ADIM is providing her with financing for her business.  She has proven to be a responsible person with her payments.  She is requesting the current loan to purchase a metal shelf, which will allow for a better view of the products offered and therefore attract a greater clientele.

loans.use: to purchase a metal shelf in order to give her clients a better view of the products offered

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa, con la ayuda de financiamiento anterior tuvo materia prima para la venta de tortillas, con ello se mantuvo trabajando por un tiempo, su situación económica ha mejorado y ha logrado establecer una tienda de consumo, cancelo su deuda y  cubre las necesidades básicas familiares. Ya no cuenta con la venta de quesos y tortillas.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo debido a la necesidad de cubrir las nuevas demandas de sus clientes, invertirá en aceite, pan, jabón, bebidas, etc., para que sus clientes estén satisfechos.
texts.en:
With the previous financial help, Rosa had the raw materials in order to sell tortillas.  With this, she remained working for a while.  Her economic situation has improved and she has been able to establish a general store, cancel her debt, and cover the necessary basic items for her family.  

Now, she does not sell cheese and tortillas.  She has decided to request a new loan due to the necessity to cover the new demands of her clients.  She will invest in oil, bread, soap, drinks, etc., so that her clients are satisfied.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders, I’d like to introduce Mrs. Monicah, 48. Together with her husband, whom she has been faithful to for 25 years, she has been blessed with three lovely kids: the eldest is 24 and the youngest is 10. 
 
Monicah only completed school through secondary and described her childhood as “supported.” Out of seven children, she was the third born.  However, she also describes herself as much more hardworking than most people and she and her husband have done well with farming, now owning a two-acre farm as well as one cow, three pigs and poultry. 

For Monicah to expand her asset base and make more profit, she is required to buy a dairy cow. For this reason, Monicah is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 for purchasing a dairy cow.

With your loan, she is optimistic that her milk sales and entrepreneurial efforts will push her dreams higher and her children's education higher.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new food items for his grocery.

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas is a 46-year-old married woman living in Irbid. She is the mother of three. 

Her son Karam studies at his own expense. They are a low-income family who were unable pay the expenses of Karam's studies. This led to extra work outside to assist his mother in the home and school fees.

So Inas has applied for a loan to cover the rest of the semester's fee for her son.

Inas is a conservative married woman so she asked her son Karam to take her place in the photo.

loans.use: To pay for the rest of the semester fee for her son.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 20-year-old single lady, living with her family in Marka. She is now in her second year of university to get a bachelor's degree majoring in Computing and Network Systems Engineering. 

Yasmeen's father is retired from the army, but his pension is not enough to meet all of the semester fees and expenses of the house. Yasmeen is therefore requesting a loan to cover her semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Rasoltaaba Sida De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur DAHAMANE est le représentant du groupe RASOLTAABA SIDA(qui signifie: il ne faut pas se cacher la vérité) DE TANGHIN. Marié, il est  père de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé à 11 ans et le moins âgé a 02mois. 02 vont à l’école.Il a 14personnes en charge.
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 39 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter  05 moutons ;30 poules et 05chèvres.
Monsieur veut épargner ses bénéfices . Il ambitionne être autonome et les gens vont venir acheter chez lui.
texts.en:
Mr. Dahamane is the representative of the Rasoltaaba Sida group (the group's name means "truth should not be hidden") of Tanghin. He is married and has seven children: the eldest is 11 years old and the youngest is two months old. Two of his children go to school. He has 14 dependents.

Mr. Dahamane has been raising livestock for 39 years. He stock ups at the nearby markets. He would like to buy five sheep, 30 chickens and five goats. He would like to set his revenue aside as savings. His goal is to become financially independent and have customers come to buy from him.

loans.use: to buy five sheep, 30 chickens and five goats.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto vive en una comunidad  llamada San Andrés Semetabaj, él es un hombre casado tiene 50 años de edad, con 5 hijos  ya todos mayores de edad. 

Augusto para la fuente  de sus ingresos se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva diversidad de hortalizas, pero una de las especialidades de él es la siembra de tomate,  y esto lo hace bajo invernadero, para protegerlo de las heladas.  Pues anteriormente por la falta de mano de obra sembraba muy poco, pero ahora que sus hijos ya lo apoyan Augusto quiere ampliar la siembra, pero el problema es que no cuentan con capital de trabajo, pues la familia de Augusto han decidido buscar un préstamo para comprar más semillas de tomate y sembrar en gran cantidad. 
Augusto con la poca cosecha que tiene ahora únicamente vende en el mercado local, pero uno de los sueños más grande de esta familia es poder exportar tomate  por mayor a otros mercados.
texts.en:
Augusto lives in a community called San Andres Semetabaj. He is a 50-year-old married man and has 5 children (all of whom are adults).

Augusto's occupation is agriculture. He grows different types of vegetables, but specializes on growing tomatoes. He grows his tomatoes in a greenhouse, to protect them from frost. In the past, he harvested very little as he lacked workers. Now that his children help him, Augusto wants to expand his crops. His current problem is that they don't have working capital, which led the family to request a loan to buy more tomato seeds and increase their crops. The little he harvests, he sells in the local market. One of this family's biggest dreams is being able to export tomatoes to other markets.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds.

loans.name: Harriette

texts.en:
Harriette is 59 years old from Estancia, Iloilo. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business at her place. She sells items like detergent powder, bleaching agent, soft drinks, canned goods and snacks. Aside from this store, she is also engaged in a rice farming business. These businesses began 35 years ago.

Harriette is asking for a loan to buy another hand tractor so that she can be more productive on her farm, and she can have it rented out to other farmers for additional income. She will also use her loan to pay for the maintenance of her hand tractor. 

In the future, she hopes to be save more and make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy another hand tractor and to pay for its maintenance

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOUSSA représente le groupe ESPOIR. WENDINMI se porte bien mais ne fait plus parti du groupe. MOUSSA est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le 01an. 01 va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Il est gérant d'une boutique depuis 04ans. Il s’approvisionne  au marché de son quartier. 
Mr veut s’acheter 02sacs de riz, 02bidons d'huile et 02cartons de spaghetti pour sa boutique.
IL  désire réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne s’acheter une moto  et mieux entretenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa represents the Espoir ["Hope"] group. Mr. Weindimni [referred to in the previous loan] is doing well but is no longer a member of the group. 
Mr. Moussa is married and has two children: the eldest is five years old and the youngest is one years old. One of his children goes to school. He has four dependents.

Mr. Moussa has been running a grocery store for four years. He stocks up at his neighborhood market. He would like to buy two bags of rice, two jugs of oil and two packs of pasta for his store. His would like to invest his revenue in his business. His goal is to buy a motorcycle and be able to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice, two jugs of oil and two packs of pasta for his store.

loans.name: Sokkhuon

texts.en:
Sokkhuon, who is 37 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children who live under her support. To make a living and support the family, she has been involved in the farming business since 2000, growing bean and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market.

The net profit that she can generate is USD 3.00 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy the seeds for her bean plantation. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy bean seeds. She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 54 years old, is a loving mother of three single children. She lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and sells the crops to local dealers. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day.

Srey is living in an old house and she wants to build a comfortable one for her family. As the shortage of budget, she is now applying a KIVA loan through HKL to buy construction supplies such as brick, cement, iron, stone, timber and sand to build a new house. Through this loan, she hopes she can experience living in a comfortable house. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build a new house

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun, 69, is a married woman from Kampong Cham Province. She has a total of seven children, five are single and two are married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice, and sells the crops to local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for fifteen years. She is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day, on average.

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide suitable living conditions for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Lilian Veronica

texts.es: Lilian es una mujer laboriosa de 29 años, acompañada, dedicada a la comercialización de ropa nueva en su domicilio, este negocio es el que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para cooperar con los gastos familiares de su hogar, este negocio lo impulsó hace tres años con capital propio de ella, ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una mueblería de ahí decidió impulsar su propio negocio para este ahorro hasta tener una cantidad suficiente e invertir en mercadería de ropa, es el décimo noveno ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona esforzada para lograr las metas propuestas, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de camisetas cuello V, camisetas blancas, camisas mangas ¾, blusas, pantalones para damas, pantalones para caballeros, etc., ya que es una de las temporadas que mayor demanda de productos tiene, se ha propuesto como meta aumentar su negocio para seguir diversificando los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Lilian is a hardworking woman.  She is 29 years old, and she has a common-law marriage. She sells new clothing from her home; and with this business she earns the income she needs in order to contribute to her home’s expenses.

She started this business three years ago with her own capital, as she used to work in a furniture store.  While working there, she decided to start her business; and she saved up until she had enough money to invest in clothing to sell.

This is her nineteenth loan cycle with ADIM, in which she is receiving financing for her business; and she has shown herself to be a person who works hard to achieve her goals.  

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of V-neck t-shirts, white t-shirts,  ¾ length sleeve shirts, blouses, men’s and women’s pants, and similar items, as this is one of the seasons when she has the greatest demand for her products.  

Her goal is to expand her business in order to continue diversifying her products.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell, as this is the season when she has the most demand for her products.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Dzame has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a married mother of two children. She works hard to support her family and improve their economy. To provide the primary income for her family, Mahbuba is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business in 2005 with 80 AZN. Thanks to Mahbuba's hard work, today her farm contains four sheep. She also grows potatoes and corn for sale on her own land. 

In order to further develop her business, Mahbuba requested a loan in the amount of 1200 AZN from Aqroinvest to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers, in order to grow ecologically-clean and delicious vegetables. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business because she wants to save money for her grandchildren's education and upbringing.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Los Arbolitos Ahorros (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Doña Ángela es una mujer muy reservada, tiene 52 años de edad y está casada con el señor Federico quien trabaja en el campo, juntos formaron una familia con 11 hijos, de los cuales dos aún dependen de ellos.

Desde hace 20 años, Ángela se ha dedicado a la elaboración de artesanías bordadas como servilletas y manteles. Desde pequeña, su mamá le enseñaba a hacerlas y cuando decidió formar su propia familia comenzó a venderlas para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus pequeños. “Mis hijos eran pequeños y teníamos una familia muy grande, los gastos eran muy fuertes, el sueldo de mi esposo no alcanzaba para todo”. A Doña Ángela le preocupaba mucho el bienestar de su familia e hizo lo posible para mejorar la situación. Con el tiempo, Ángela ha adquirido experiencia y ahora también hace manteles grandes, figuras más intrincadas y la combinación de colores es más llamativa, ella misma crea todos sus diseños.

Ángela está muy agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA porque menciona que si ahora tiene muchos clientes que le hacen pedidos es gracias a su trabajo pero también al préstamo que le ha permitido adquirir telas, hilos y estambres de mayor calidad. Recuerda que gracias a los préstamos pudo ampliar su negocio, sacar adelante a sus hijos “...y hasta ahora lo sigo haciendo con mis dos hijos pequeños”. Además, a Ángela le encantaría seguir creciendo, vender en otras comunidades para que más personas conozcan sus artesanías.

Los demás integrantes del grupo también están muy agradecidos con su préstamo porque poco a poco han crecido en sus negocios. Doña Juliana invertirá en su molino de nixtamal, Don Maximino en su tienda de abarrotes y Doña Magdalena en cosméticos. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco del municipio. Ángela viste un suéter rojo y está sonriendo.
texts.en:
Doña Ángela is a very reserved woman. She is 52 years old and married to señor Federico, who works in the field. Together they created a family of 11 children, of which two still depend on them.

For 20 years, Ángela has worked making embroidered craftwork such as napkins and tablecloths. Since she was little, her mother taught her to make them and when she decided to start her own family, she began to sell them to support her husband with the expenses of the home and their children’s education. “My children were young and we had a very large family. The expenses were very high, and the salary of my husband didn’t cover everything.” The wellbeing of her family worried Doña Ángela a lot, and she did what she could to improve the situation. With time, Ángela acquired experience and now she also has large tablecloths, more intricate figures, and the color combinations are more striking. She creates all of the designs herself. 

Ángela is very grateful for VisionFund and Kiva because if she now has many customers who request from her, it is thanks to her work but also the loan that has allowed her to acquire fabric, thread, and long-staple wool of better quality. She remembers that thanks to the loans she was able to expand her business and get her children ahead “…and I still continue doing it with my two young children.” In addition, Ángela would love to continue growing and to sell in other communities so that more people know her craftwork.

The other members of the group are also very grateful for their loan because little by little they have grown their businesses. Doña Juliana will invest in a corn grinder, Don Maximino in his grocery store, and Doña Magdalena in cosmetics.

• The photograph was taken on the stairs under the town pavilion. Ángela is wearing a red sweater and is smiling.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and long-staple wool.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Miriam Soledad

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 38 años de edad, su familia es unida, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas, patos, cuyes, entre otros, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, patos, gallinas, entre otros, así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría (corrales), con esto Miriam espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo así sus gustos y preferencias, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ventas y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam is 38 years old, her family is together, and she lives in her own house with her husband and children in the Cayaltí district, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the northern part of Perú. She lives in a community dedicated to business, farming, and ranching.

She makes a living raising and selling small animals like pigs, chickens, ducks, guinea pigs, among others. She has 10 years of experience in the business and regular customers who provide her with very good personal and work references. The current loan will be used to buy more animals like pigs, ducks, chickens, among others, and also to make repairs and maintain the place where she raises them (corrals). With this, Miriam hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers, and in that way satisfy their tastes and preferences, which she will see reflected in a higher level of sales, which will allow her to improve her and her family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy more animals like pigs, ducks, chickens, and also to make repairs to the place where she raises them (corrals).

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for manufacturing picture frames

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more human drugs for to selling in her drug shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Poverty is a dehumanizing condition for everyone. It erodes human rights of the affected, whether women or men. Poverty subjects an individual to a state of powerlessness, hopelessness, and lack of self-esteem, confidence, and integrity, leading to a situation of multidimensional vulnerability.  As many people in Kenya are poor, with the women bearing the brunt of it, reducing its impact as well as breaking its vicious circle requires a concerted effort and a gender perspective in all the interceptive strategies. The commitment of Juhudi Kilimo to eradicate poverty is manifested in its current strategy to make available loans to women smallholder farmers.

Lenders! The above picture presents to you Jane, 36 years of age. She is very ambitious and enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of two, and has been doing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are maize selling, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Jane loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow, and she really takes good care of her dairy cows. 

The Kerugoya area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming; good soils, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Jane wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming, and through improved income she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. The financial benefits that Jane will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Pillao Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PILLAO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanet ,la socia continua con su negocio de  crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan cada dia,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para sus animalitos.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la carpintería, venta de verduras, fábrica de ladrillos, bar, crianza de animales menores, venta de chicha, venta de comida.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "PILLAO." This bank is located in Cusco district, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department.

Yanet continues her business of raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She thanks those who form part of this dream through these means, and she promises to make her payments in the period established for her loan. She is a responsable and diligent person. She continues raising her little animals to then sell them to her customers who request them every day. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. 

She is asking for the loan in order to buy guinea pigs and food for her little animals.

The other members make a living through carpentry, selling vegetables, making bricks, bar, raising small animals, selling chicha, and selling food.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and food for her little animals

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 23-year-old single man.  He lives with his family in Ajloun. Since childhood, he dreamed of becoming a professional soccer player, but that could not be achieved. 

However, his dream did not end as he decided to complete his degree in sports rehabilitation at the university to become the coach of the soccer team.

Hussein is now in his final school year, but the high cost of living life and the cost of his brothers study led him to work in a furniture shop when he is not studying. Hussein is applying for a loan to help pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for this semester's school fees.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is an industrious 26-year-old farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. He is the last born in a family of six. He got educated only up to the secondary level before having to drop out to make ends meet. He started farming two years ago. On a 2-acre piece of land, he keeps 1 cow, 2 goats and 13 heads of poultry. He also employs irrigation techniques to grow crops both for food and to sell in the market. 

As the planting season draws closer, Benjamin is worried about not being able to afford pricey farm inputs such as fertilizer. This threatens his food security and income since animals in his farm also rely on feed for milk production. Benjamin is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizer, which is necessary for successful growth of healthy crops. He will use income from his other sources to make initial payments towards the loan. 

Making a loan to this young farmer will enable him to build a strong financial foundation for his future family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer

loans.name: Rai

texts.en:
Rai is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to renovate the house.

loans.name: Colin Ahorros (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Colin” está integrado por tres mujeres muy trabajadoras Rosa y Elisea son muy demasiado sociables y Antonia es más seria, pero tienen una relación muy estrecha y siempre se apoyan.

Antonia tiene 51 años de edad, actualmente vive con su mamá y a pesar de ser reservada le gusta mucho el contacto con las personas que ya conoce. Desde hace 30 años tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes a la que ha agregado la venta de chiles secos. El negocio pertenecía a sus padres pero ahora ella es la encargada. "Desde pequeñas mis hermanas y yo veíamos cómo se esforzaban, nos enseñaron todo acerca del negocio porque decían que era lo mejor que nos podían brindar".

Antonia necesita un préstamo para invertir en su pequeña tienda y comprar leche, huevo, pan, azúcar, sal, frituras, aguas, refrescos etc. Está muy agradecida con el apoyo porque cada vez que recibe el dinero tiene la oportunidad de comprar más variedad de productos para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes. Desafortunadamente, en la comunidad de Antonia hay tiendas más grandes y eso ha provocado que sus ganancias sean cada vez menos, pero tampoco quisiera cerrar su negocio. “Por eso mismo hemos recurrido a los préstamos, para no dejar caer nuestros negocios”. Normalmente, con sus ganancias adquiere cosas personales como ropa, zapatos, alimento, etc. y también apoya económicamente a su mamá. 

Así como Antonia, las demás integrantes del grupo están muy contentas y agradecidas porque han podido hacer crecer sus negocios y además porque en estas fechas sus ventas son aún mejor y necesitan del capital para invertir. Rosa Aurelia invertirá en la venta de ropa y Elisea en sus artesanías.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio. En la foto ellas aparecen con algunas piezas artesanales de Elisea. Antonia es quien viste el suéter blanco.
texts.en:
The "Colin" group is composed of three hard-working women. Rosa and Elisea are very outgoing, and Antonia is more reserved; however, they have a close-knit relationship, and they always support each other.

Antonia is 51 years old. Currently, she lives with her mother, and, in spite of being a reserved woman, she enjoys being in touch with the people she already knows. For the past 30 years, she has been running a small grocery store, to which she has added the sale of dried hot peppers. The business used to belong to her parents, but now she runs it. "Ever since we were very young, my sisters and I used to see the efforts they made; they taught us everything about the business because they used to say that it was the best thing they could ever give us."

Antonia needs a loan to invest in her small store and buy milk, eggs, bread, sugar, salt, beverages, deep-fried snacks, soft drinks, and the like. She is very grateful for the support because each time she receives the money, she has the opportunity to buy a wider variety of products to improve her customer service. Unfortunately, in Antonia's community there are larger stores, a situation that has caused her profits to decrease. However, she wouldn't want to close her business. "For this reason, we have resorted to take out loans so that we don't let our businesses go under." Usually, with her profits she acquires personal items such as clothes, shoes, food, and the like. She also supports her mother financially.

Like Antonia, the other group members are very happy and grateful because they have been able to grow their businesses and also because around this time, their sales are even better, and they need the money to invest. Rosa Aurelia will invest in selling clothes and Elisea in her handicrafts.

*The photograph was taken on the stairs of the municipal bandstand. The group members appear with some of Elisea's handicrafts. Antonia is the one wearing a white sweater.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, bread, sugar, salt, deep-fried snacks, beverages, soft drinks, and the like.

location.town: Santa Ana Nichi, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en: Hanane is a married woman and a mother of three children. While her husband works long hours every day of the week as a construction worker, she runs a shop that sells embroideries and needle crafts. And presently, she looks forward to a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more threads and textile, as she seeks to increase her production and please her customers' demands. Hanane’s only hope for the future is that she and her husband are able to provide for their children so they are guaranteed kinder futures.

loans.use: purchase more threads and textile

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 30 years old. He is married with two children aged between 3 and 6 years old. Both children attend school.  He has farmed for 21 years and will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor, 29 years old, is a mother of four children and lives in southern Ghour.

She represents ambitious woman and wants to help her husband with the household expenses to provide a decent life for her family. Noor opened her small business selling cosmetics and some accessories. Noor`s neighbors and friends provide her support that increased her self-confidence. That’s why Noor had to apply for a loan to help her develop her business and increase sales.

loans.use: to help her develop her business and increase sales.

loans.name: Chausiku

texts.en:
Chausiku is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Chausiku operates a vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Esther has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes for both adults and kids. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock enough clothes for the store so as to attract more customers, and will help Esther to generate greater profits. Esther takes care of her family, so some of the capital will be used to pay for rent where they are staying. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a bigger store that will include even men's clothes. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock enough clothes for the store so as to attract more customers

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rose operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
