loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, a 67-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy more cow salt to sell. He still sells cow salts as his main source of income alongside cattle fattening. He started this business to provide for his family. He has personal goals of educating his children and opening up outlets in other parts of Kamwenge.
 
His main hardships are high competition and inadequate capital to meet increasing demand. He hopes to own a wholesale cow salt store. Godfrey intends to use this loan to buy more cow salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cow salt to sell.

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is a 22-year-old single lady who lives with her family in Marka. She is now in the second year of university. She likes economics and banking systems, and is studying for a Bachelor's degree majoring in economics and Islamic banks. Her father retired from the army, but his pension is not enough to meet all semester fees and expenses of the house.

Somaya is applying for a loan to cover the remainder of her semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for the remainder of her semester fees.

loans.name: Jabel

texts.en:
Jabel is a 34-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income, although he also carries out timber cutting and selling to earn an extra income. He started this business with the intention of generating funds to meet personal goals. He hopes to expand his businesses and have a big farm but he faces a challenge of the lack of capital to meet the increasing demands and prolonged drought.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonio es una ama de casa, a pesar de su edad ella, es una señora muy dedica a su trabajo, y muy responsable con su pareja,  ella es una mujer casada de 55 años, tiene 5 hijos  dos varones y tres mujeres ya mayores de dieciocho años. 

Ella durante toda su vida siempre le ha gustado la crianza de ganados y pollos de corral y los vende en los lugares circunvecinos,  ya que con este oficio ella apoya a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y con este trabajo ha sacado adelante a sus hijos en estudiar.  Ella como  madre de familia  se siente comprometida en seguir apoyando a su familia. 

Ella a pesar de ser mujer y una persona grande, siempre ha soñado  remodelar su casa, y crear más  ambientes, para que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor comodidad,  ella está buscando un préstamo para apoyar a su esposo, para realizar este trabajo, pues con las ganancias que genera sus ganados y pollos ella pagaría el préstamo lo mas antes que pueda. Este es el sueño más grande de Antonia.
texts.en:
Antonia is a homemaker. Despite her age, she is very dedicated to her work and very responsible with her husband. She is married and is 55 years old. She has 5 children, two sons and three daughters, all of age, over 18 years old. 

During her whole life, she has always liked raising livestock and chickens. She sells them in nearby towns. With this work, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses and she has been able to help her children with their studies. As a mother, she feels the obligation to continue supporting her family.

Despite being a woman and an older person, she has always dreamed of remodeling her house and adding rooms so her children could have a greater level of comfort. She is seeking a loan in order to help her husband in achieving this work. With the earnings from her livestock and chickens, she will pay the loan as soon as she can. This is Antonia's greatest dream.

loans.use: to pay for re-finishing her house.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail used his previous loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his banana plantation. He is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He still grows coffee and bananas as his main source of income, although he also runs a drug shop and uses his motorcycle (boda boda) to earn extra income. His business is affected by seasonal demands for his products. He has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer and educating his children. 

He request a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Eunice, a 59-year-old mother who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Eunice is a mother and she really loves and adores so much her family and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Eunice hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Eunice never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Eunice started farming and has been doing farming for the past three years. Through those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Eunice practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”. 

Eunice is a woman who is very enterprising and she is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Eunice wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

 Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Eunice to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Eunice hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Eunice’s dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Eunice is not a selfish woman and also wants to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish and resell them in the local market.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 23-year-old single woman. She lives with her brother in Salt, after the death of her parents. Huda is now in her second year of university, seeking to get a bachelor's degree and majoring in Banking and Financial Sciences. She is also working at the university part-time to help her pay part of her fees.
So as not to overburden her brother, she applied for a loan to help pay her semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She practices farming as her main source of income, although she also runs a small restaurant as her side income. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain herself and take care of her children. Bad weather and inadequate capital are her main challenges but hopes to have a big coffee plantation in some years to come.

She is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for her farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 32-year-old married woman with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a cocoa farmer and she has been in the business of cocoa farming and selling since 1998. She is a very hardworking woman and hopes to construct a permanent house. She loves her business but she is limited by capital.

She wants a loan to enable her to burn her bricks and start building.

loans.use: to burn her bricks and begin building

loans.name: Alexis De Jesus

texts.es:
Alexis, de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, la situación económica de su familia lo obligo a retirarse de sus estudios y buscar una fuente de ingresos, esta casado desde hace 1 año y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Alexis, actualmente presta sus servicios como militar, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que fue una alternativa viable para el obtener el sustento diario para su familia.-

Alexis, anteriormente se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos como, maíz, frijol y además, trabajaba cortando café y sembrando hortalizas. Para llegar al lugar de su trabajo viaja en bus aproximadamente 2 horas.

Alexis, con el financiamiento pretende comprar tejas, ladrillos y además pagar la mano de obra, para construir. 
	
Alexis, sueña con tener su casa propia; además aspira a obtener un mejor rango en la Institución donde labora, para tener un mejor ingreso, con el que pueda mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alexis is 24 years old. He studied until eighth grade. His family's economic situation obligated him to leave his studies to look for a source of income. He has been married for 1 year and his wife is a homemaker.

Alexis is currenly working in the military. He decided to dedicate himself to this work because it was a viable alternative for providing for his family.

Alexis used to plant basic grains, such as corn and beans. He also picked coffee and planted vegetables. In order to arrive at his work, he travels approximately 2 hours by bus.

With the loan, Alexis plans to buy roof tiles, bricks, and pay for labor to build.

Alexis dreams of having his own house. He also aspires to a higher rank at the institution where he works so that he can have a better income. With this, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles, bricks, and pay for labor to build.

loans.name: Kaaria

texts.en:
Kaaria grew up on a farm property in the Igoji Division in Central Kenya. He farms with his wife of 9 years near Nkubu town; they own 1.5 acres, which they started working in 2008. Their property had a tap-water supply, so the challenge for them was to find something they could do with the water on their small farm to sustain them. What better than horticulture farming?

Kaaria is seeking a loan to grow more crops on their farm. In order for him to grow more crops, he needs support from Kiva lenders in the form of a loan to pay for farm inputs and related expenses anticipated during planting season.

Kaaria will use income from milk sales to make initial loan repayments before the crops mature for harvesting. The money that will pour in from this investment will go to his family’s basic needs and the education expenses for his 2 children, who are 5 and 8 years old.

loans.use: to pay for horticulture farming expenses

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 47 years old. He is married with 2 children, aged 15 and 23. Both children attend school. Emmanuel has farmed for years and will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to grow rice, which he will then sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and pay his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged between 5 and 15 years old. All of them go to school. She has farmed for 28 years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice, which she will then sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice for sale

loans.name: Beatrice.

texts.en: Beatrice is a 31-year-old Ugandan married and hardworking woman living in Kagadi. She operates a retail shop to generate income. She hopes to buy land and to pay school fees for her children despite capital insufficiency and delayed payment by debtors. Beatrice is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, shoe polish and other items for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, shoe polish and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and rice to sell

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside con su familia en una aldea de Gracias, Lempira. Desde joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, y hace 8 años que cultiva café, el cual vende en pergamino en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un prestamo por 7,000 lempiras para limpieza y comprar fertilizantes para aplicar en la finca de café. Con esta inversión el espera mejorar la cosecha y producción. Su plan es seguir dándole asistencia al cultivo y sembrar otra área de café.
texts.en: José is 39 years old. He is married, has 4 children, and lives with his family in a small town near Gracias, Lempira. Since the time he was young, he has worked in agriculture, cultivating corn and beans. For the past 8 years he has also grown coffee, which he sells at the parchment stage [green coffee with a thick membrane still on it] in the local market. He has requested a loan of 7,000 HNL (Honduran Lempiras) to weed the coffee farm and buy fertilizers for application on the farm. With this loan he expects to improve his harvest and production. His plan is to continue maintaining his crop and to plant another area with coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use on his coffee farm.

loans.name: El Que Persevera Alcanza Group

texts.es: Con el propósito de adquirir un financiamiento en ADIM para capitalizar sus negocios se formó un grupo llamado “El que persevera alcanza”, es guiado por la coordinadora Ana de 49 años de edad, una mujer dedicada y con un solo propósito en la vida, sacar adelante a su familia mediante su negocio que es la venta de perecederos (frutas, verduras, legumbres) en el mercado municipal desde hace treinta años, esta actividad la empezó con ayuda de su esposo, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de pepino, lechuga, repollo, apio, papas, etc. Los otros integrantes del grupo son; Darvin un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad que a muy corta edad aprendió los oficios de un comerciante y ya con cinco años de experiencia se ha dedicado a la comercialización de frutas y verduras  en el mercado municipal, y Luisa una señora de 34 años de edad que con la hecha y venta de tortillas lleva el sustento a su familia contando con cuatro años de experiencia. De esta manera se consolidó el grupo con personas responsables y optimistas.
texts.en:
With the goal of acquiring a loan at ADIM for capital for thier businesses, they formed a group called "El que persevera alcanza" [The one who perseveres achieves.] It is led by the group president, Ana, who is 49 years old. She is a hardworking person with just one goal in life--to provide for her family through her business selling perishables (fruits and vegetables) in the municipal market, which she has been doing for thirty years. She started this business with the help of her husband. 

She is requesting the current loan to buy cucumbers, lettuce, cabbage, celery, potatoes, etc. The other members of the group are: Darvin is a young entrepreneur, 21 years old, who from a young age learned how to work in commerce. With five years of experience, he sells fruits and vegetables in the municipal market. Luisa is 34 years old and provides for her family by making and selling tortillas. She has four years of experience. In this way, the group was created with responsible and optimistic people.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, with the goal of continuing to diversify the products she offers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman and has two kids who attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Margaret has operated a tailoring business for the past 6 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

She wants to use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread

loans.name: Isidora Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Isidora, tiene 57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos  mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Isidora es una mujer que le gusta trabajar por el bien de su familia, ella tiene un bazar en un local que arrienda  en el centro de la ciudad, allí ella vende ropa, zapatos, bisutería, helados, perfumes, tarjetas y muchos artículos más para regalos así como también recargas telefónicas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, ya son más de 6 años que lleva con este negocio el cual comenzó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, helados y todo lo que ella vende en su local. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que los arriendos se le llevan gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
In the "24 de Mayo" canton in Manabi province, a place known for its beautiful scenery, its forest, the variety of its wildlife, and its friendly and hardworking people who farm and raise livestock, the communal bank "Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor" meets every 15 days.

This is where Isadora, 57, lives.  She is in a common law marriage and has 5 grown children who are independent.  Her husband is a driver.

Isidora is a woman who likes working for her family's well-being.  She has a store in a rented place in the center of the city where she sells clothing, shoes, accessories, ice cream, perfumes, cards, and many more gift items.  She also sells cell phone minutes.  She works every day from 8am until 6pm.  She's already had this business for more than 6 years.  She started the business with one of the loans she received with this group.

Isidora will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, ice cream, and everything else that she sells from her store.  She's been a member of her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.  Her dream is to have her own store, since the rent eats up a large part of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is 50 years old and married with four children, some of whom who are still attending school. Three years ago, and after struggling with harsh financial situations, she got involved in the agricultural field. She owns a small territory where she performs her cultivation operations and she specializes in growing vegetables and fruits. Currently, with the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will buy seeds and plants needed with the aim of increasing her productivity and her revenue. Maha says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family’s standards of living, which at present are very difficult. In the future, she would like to see her business grow and earn enough profit.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plants

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 29 years old. He is married with three children between 3 and 10 years old. Two of his children attend school.  He has farmed for 15 years and will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a single woman who lives with three relatives. She is 39 years old and she collaborates with her brother to afford the heavy life expenses. Since 1995, Diana has worked as a tailor at her house. She is well known for her kind spirit and creative tailoring abilities. She is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to expand her inventory of textile and tailoring machinery to create more designs for her customers. Diana plans for more expansion in the coming years, and her main goal is to become the owner of a proper tailoring shop.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of textile and tailoring machinery

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of Kes 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel, de 53 años de edad, está casado, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, tiene cinco hijos, pero todos están casados.

Fidel, ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, ya que este fue el oficio que le enseñaron sus padres y es de donde el obtiene sus ingresos para comprar lo que se necesita un su casa.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar cuatro novillas, para poder cuidarlas ya que siempre ha tenido ganado para crecerlo y engordarlo para luego venderlo y de esta manera poder obtener ganancias en corto tiempo.

Fidel, sueña con llegar a tener 12 novillas para crecerla y engordarlas.
texts.en:
Fidel is 53 years old and married. His wife does the housework, and he has five children, but they are all married.

Fidel has worked his whole life farming and raising livestock, since this was the work that his parents taught him and from which he obtains his income to buy what is needed in his home.

He needs the money from the loan to buy four heifers to raise. He has always had cattle to raise and fatten for later sale, and in this way he can make a profit in a short time.

Fidel dreams of having as many as 12 heifers to raise and fatten.

loans.use: to buy four heifers

loans.name: Nex Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Nex" está integrado por nueve personas que viven en una comunidad mazahua muy conocida por sus ricos capulines que se dan a mitad del año; la mayoría de las familias tienen un árbol frutal de este tipo.

Sabina o Sabi, como le dicen de cariño, es una mujer muy alegre y amable, siempre está sonriendo y logra contagiar a los demás integrantes del grupo. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con Eduardo quien trabaja en la construcción de casas y tienen una niña de 11 años quien esta estudiando su educación primaria.

Sabi se dedicó a vender productos de de belleza y dulces durante seis años pero los negocios no le dejaban las ganancias que ella deseaba. Después se dio cuenta que rentar mesas y sillas era más productivo por los eventos que se realizan en su comunidad y utilizó sus ahorros para comprar 50 sillas y 5 mesas. Ya son tres años de experiencia en esta actividad y en fin de año sus ganancias son mejores. 

Sabi, lleva casi 8 años como cliente de VisionFund, está muy agradecida porque sin el apoyo económico no habría podido crecer, específicamente porque las sillas son caras. Actualmente tiene 100 sillas y 10 mesas y está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar más. Sus ganancias le han permitido mejorar su calidad de vida y ha hecho algunos arreglos a su vivienda, pero sobretodo puede pagar con mayor facilidad las colegiaturas de su niña. “Para mí es muy importante que mi hija se prepare para tener una carrera profesional y pueda superarse”.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Apolonia quien invertirá en lonas para eventos; Raul, Ana Cecilia, Maria Cristina y Héctor, en dulces; Marlem, en su tienda de abarrotes; Viviana, en ropa y Victoria, en la cría de pavos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del quisoco del municipio, en la parte de atrás se puede apreciar la parroquia católica, Sabi es quien viste un suéter gris y tiene flequillo.
texts.en:
The "Nex" group is made up of nine people who live in a Mazahua community that is well-known for the delicious chokecherries that are in season half-way through the year. Most ofthe families have one of these fruit trees.

Sabina, or "Sabi," as she is affectionately known, is a very cheerful and friendly person. She is always smiling and manages to spread her smile to the the other members of the group. She is 30 years old, lives in common law marriage with Eduardo (who works in house construction), and has an 11 year-old girl who is studying in primary school.

Sabi has been selling beauty products and sweets for six years, but these businesses didn't give her the income she hoped for. Later she realized that renting tables and chairs was more productive because of the events that are done in her community. She used her savings to buy 50 chairs and 5 tables. She has three years of experience in this business and, at the end of the year, her earnings are better. 

Sabi has been a client of VisionFund for almost 8 years. She is very grateful because without the economic support, she wouldn't have been able to grow, specifically because the chairs are expensive. She currently has 100 chairs and 10 tables, and she is requesting the loan to buy more. Her earnings have allowed her to improve her quality of life and she has made some repairs to her house. Most importantly, she is able to pay more easily her daughter's school fees. "For me, it's very important that my daughter be well prepared to have to have a professional career so she can get ahead."

The other members of the group are Apolonia, who will invest in tarps for events; Raul, Ana Cecilia, Maria Cristina, and Hector, who sell sweets; Marlem, who has a grocery store; Viviana, who sells clothing; and Victoria, who raises turkeys.

*The photograph was taken on the steps below the municipal kiosk. In the background, you can see the Catholic parish. Sabi is the one in a gray sweater and who has bangs.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables.

location.town: El Valerio, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Fatoumata Kito's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place depuis le novembre 2004, le banc villageois regroupe des femmes d’un même village et hameaux environnant. Elles entretiennent de très bon rapport de voisinage et ont pour la majorité une longue et riche expérience dans le système des bancs villageois. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce et la transformation.

Madame Fatoumata (assise à l’extrême droite),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans, mariée  et mère de 02 enfants dont une fille et un garçon. Elle fait de la transformation de  pâte d’arachide. Elle achète les graines non décortiquées par sacs de 50 voir 60 kilos pour la transformation et la vente par seaux de 05 et 20 kilos. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans le domaine pour l’avoir fréquenté pendant plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle souhaite acheter au moins 08 sacs pour la transformation et la vente.

Les bénéfices seront utilisés à mieux assister son mari dans la gestion des charges de la famille surtout sur le plan de la nourriture.
texts.en:
Established in November 2004, the "banc villageois" loan association brings together women from the same village and its surrounding hamlets. They entertain good neighborly relations and most of them have had a long and enriching experience in the "banc villageois" system. They are small retail merchants and active in food processing.

Mrs. Fatoumata (seated at the far right) is the group's featured borrower. She is 43 years old, married with two children, including a girl and a boy. She processes groundnut paste.

She buys unshelled groundnuts in 50- or 60-kilo bags for processing and sales in 5-kilo or 20-kilo buckets. She has extensive experience in this area with several years' practice.

She wants to use the new loan to buy at least eights bags (of groundnuts) for processing and sale.

The profits will be used to better assist her husband in managing family expenses, particularly in terms of food.

loans.use: buy at least eight bags (of groundnuts) for processing and sale.

loans.name: Brown

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Brown, a mixed famer in Nkubu town, which is widely known to be one of the most fertile areas in Kenya. Mr. Brown farms together with his wife Victoria. To provide for his wife and two children, Brown is invested in maize, banana, poultry and dairy farming. This year, Brown is determined to focus more on the horticultural side of his business, which has great potential in the market. He is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 for paying farm input expenses.

Brown has been in the farming business for half a decade. He is planning to make the most out of his farm by growing more crops both for food and selling at the market. The additional income from this investment will go to his children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Abavandimwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Aisha  fait partie du groupe  Abavandimwe II et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 43. Elle a 2 enfants  l’un a  13 et l’autre  25 ans, dont  1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de savon, farine de maïs,...  depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son septième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de savons, de farine de maïs,…à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter sa propre maison, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Aisha is a member of the 'Abavandimwe II' Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 43 years old, widowed and mother to two children.  One of her children is 13 years old and the other is 25 years old, one of her children is attending school.  Aisha has been selling soap and maize flour for eight years.

This will be the seventh loan for Aisha with the field partner, Turame.  It will increase her working capital and she will buy a lot of soap and maize flour for resale.  Aisha hopes this will increase her earnings.

In the coming years, Aisha would like to buy her own house and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a lot of soap and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a married woman and has three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Philomena has operated a tailoring business for the past five years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep water, drinks, and some foods in a cold condition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy goats for resale as meat.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en: Giau would like to take a further loan to buy a greater variety of food such as duck eggs and snack food products to sell from her stall. Giau's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of food such as duck eggs and snack food products to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a young woman, 47 years old, from Borjomi district. She has an eight-member family and they don't have any significant income for their existence. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category and lives in poverty. The family members get social assistance from the local government. Apart from this, they have a small agricultural activity. In particular, they own a milk cow and four calves, and they sell cheese and milk locally. In addition, Leila's family owns a small plot of agricultural land where they grow potatoes and haricot.

Leila has a great desire to do her bit for her family's welfare, and to somehow increase their income. To realize her plans, she requires financial support and has obtained credit from local financial institutions. Leila requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provisions for business start-ups and restart-up credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, and lack of access to credit products. 

With the received credit, she will purchase a minibus and will rent it out daily to generate a stable income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and rent it out daily in order to increase her family's income

loans.name: Balimaya-Kadi 1/2 Group

texts.fr: Korotimi est une brave dame qui fait le commerce des céréales depuis 20 ans, elle est la responsable de ce groupe. Elle vend parallèlement de la glace et des pagnes.Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants majeurs dont deux filles mariées. Korotimi a besoin du prêt pour acheter 8 sacs de maïs, 5 sacs de mil, 2 sacs d'arachide, 3 sacs de Haricot pour vendre. les bénéfices lui permettront de continuer ses activités.
texts.en:
Korotimi is a courageous woman who has been selling cereals for twenty years now.  She is the group representative.  She also makes money by selling ice and pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing).

Korotimi is married and has four grown-up children, two of whom are married women.  She needs this loan to buy eight sacks of maize, five sacks of millet, two sacks of peanuts and three sacks of beans for resale.  Her profits will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals (maize, millet, peanuts, beans, etc) for resale.

loans.name: Sama Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sama. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.

Fadia is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of four children, living with them in an old house in a poor area in Sana'a. Her husband is an employee in the private sector with a small salary, which is not enough to make the necessary renovations for their house. Fadia applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction supplies to make some necessary renovations for the house.

Fadia hopes to complete all the renovations of the house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to make some necessary renovations for her house.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Her name is Sharon, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Rolando, they have one child who is still in the Elementary level in school. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their child's schooling.

Sharon operates a tricycle. Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Palawan, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use for maintenance of her tricycle. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation is a necessity in their place. She wishes everyone a Blessed New Year!

Sharon dreams of being successful so she can give her child the best education in order for her child to have a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for new parts and maintenance

loans.name: Botros

texts.en:
Botros is a 19-year-old single man from Bethlehem city. His father has a workshop for making religious and traditional wooden gifts made from olive wood. He learned it from his father and now he works alone in this workshop. It is a very good business and the demand is high.

Botros took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw materials like olive wood bars and paints for his workshop. By taking this loan, Botros will be able to increase his productivity and sell more. This will help him to improve the family's living conditions.

Botros appears in the photo while he is working

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like olive wood bars and paints for his workshop.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita is 51 years old and has two daughters. She makes sweaters, hats, and other clothes with wool and uses machines in the process. She learned this business 20 years ago, and she works with one of her daughters. She needs a loan to buy wool and will appreciate your help.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Renieh

texts.en:
Renieh is a 43-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is a mother of one son and two daughters. Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. Renieh works as an employee at a local firm. She would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. 

Renieh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Renieh will be able to provide hot water for her family without using electricity.
 
Renieh appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en: Lorenzo is 20 years old and lives with his uncle in El Alto. He works at a car wash fixing tires. He recently inherited some land, and he needs a loan to build his home and other rooms to rent. He is planning to go to college and hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to build his home and other rooms to rent

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
His name is Silvestre, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Yolanda, a housewife, and has two children. He works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Silvestre owns and oversees operation of his jeepney service. He has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. Most of the time, the jeepneys are constantly packed with passengers. Jeepneys offer one of the cheapest ways of getting somewhere. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the second World War and are still to be seen throughout the Philippines, in many colors and all over the place. Originally, jeepneys were old American jeeps. They were used in the war against the Japanese army which occupied the Philippines for several years. After the Japanese army was defeated and the American military mission was completed, the jeeps were left by the tens of thousands on the islands in the Philippines. The Filipinos saw possibilities to make out of these jeeps. They saw a real transportation means by making these jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats in them, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. Jeepney transport service is one of the stable businesses in the Philippines.

To help Silvestre continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which he will use for repairs and maintenance of his jeepney. It is very important that his unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. He is assured that his jeepney is well taken care of. His earnings from his service is their means of living. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him. He wishes evryone a Blessed New Year!

Silvestre hopes that their transport service will continue to be successful. He dreams for his children to get the best education. Every week, He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for jeepney maintenance

loans.name: Yovanole

texts.en: Yovanole is 27 years old, married, and the father of 3 kids. He is a shoemaker who specializes in making shoes for native women. He sells his shoes by the dozen. Yovanole wants a loan to buy supplies to make shoes, such as glue, cloth, and other materials. He will appreciate it a lot if you help him.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make shoes, such as glue, cloth, and other materials

loans.name: Motivadas Por Un Sueño 3 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of this group, which is called Motivadas por un Sueño 3 (Motivated by a Dream) group. The area in which the borrowers live is a rural zone, surrounded by mountains and rivers. Maribel lives with her long-term partner and her child in the beautiful town of El Seibo. She is a young woman fighting to see her dream come true: to have a stable and sustainable business. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family and friends.

Maribel is receiving her 9th loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic, having repaid all her previous loans. After almost five years of investment, her business is growing, and she is reaching more people with her underwear sales, wholesaling to other sellers and also retailing to regular customers. She always reinvests her profits in her business and also saves for her family's needs. Maribel thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To purchase underwear

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 46 years old and is married to a driver; they live in El Alto and have 2 kids who are in school. Amalia makes French fries and other snacks at her house and sells her products at many schools and markets. She is doing well with this business and needs a loan to enlarge the workshop where she cooks her fries. Amalia wants to see her kids become educated persons with a college diploma, so she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to enlarge the workshop where she cooks

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Vision”, located in the rural community of San Francisco el Alto in Western Guatemala, is so excited to report that they finished paying off the second loan funded by KIVA investors, to whom they send their gratitude for supporting their small business so they can have an income to support their families. Because of their confidence, once again the trust bank Vision is applying for a third loan. They hope that Kiva investors can support them one more time, because these ladies are determined to change their lives and create a better future for themselves and their families.  

Alicia is a member of the Trust Bank. She is 30 years old, and is married with two children who are attending primary school. Alicia was only able to attend primary school. but because she is empowering herself through the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” Program that combines small loans and education, she is determined to move forward and succeed. 

Alicia works from home in order to take care of her children. She is able to generate income for her small family. Alicia makes traditional skirts called “cortes” that she later sells in the region’s big textile market. Her business enjoys increased sales during the busy season of the year, especially for special events, and so she has additional employees to help out. But most of the year, she works alone. Alicia is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, zippers, buttons and other supplies to make more garments. She wants to increase her income and profits, with the goal of seeing her children complete their education. Alicia is very aware that education is key to a successful and prosperous life.

KIVA investors are much-appreciated partners for these women. Thank you for your support and confidence in the women of  the “Vision” Trust Bank!

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, zippers, buttons and other supplies to make more traditional skirts.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Her name is Mary Ann, 24. She is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines, married to Fernando, a security officer, and has two kids. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their children's  schooling. 

Mary Anne operates a tricycle and a farm. She drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Silang, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes  to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of Php 700 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan which she will use for maintenance of her tricycle and also fertilizer for her crops. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation is really a need in their place. She is wishing everyone a Blessed New Year!

Mary Ann dreams to be successful in her business so she can give her children the best education in order for them to have a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for tires and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Ziburaikarire Silc Group

texts.en:
Lawrence a 58-year-old man married with children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating a hotel business for many years in the rural area of Kyenjojo. He is faced with a lack of capital to buy more food warmers. 

Lawrence is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other for the loan. Lawrence is requesting a loan to buy more hotel furniture and utensils.

loans.use: to buy more hotel furniture and utensils.

loans.name: Them

texts.en: Them, 60, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earns an income through the business of selling blankets and bed stuff. Them started this business for six years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying bamboo mats to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bamboo mats to sell in her shop.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 3 Group

texts.en:
Cristina is a member of “El Sol Sale Para Todos 3 (The Sun Rises for Everyone)". They are micro businesspeople in clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoes, fish, food, etc. in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the most rural cities in the country whose economy depends on agriculture.

This young lady is now receiving her ninth loan. Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily and she has made good investments. She is currently operating a “Fantasia” (small general store), where she sells different miscellaneous products. She is planning to use the new loan to buy cosmetics, women's accessories and jewellery, clothes and also shoes. She will use profits to invest in her business. She dreams to have a successful business. Cristina thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothes, etc to sell.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 20-year-old single man, living with his family in their own house in Taiz city, Yemen. He is a student in a university and needs a laptop and its accessories to use in his studies. He strives strongly to get high marks in the university but lacks a laptop to help him with his studies. Jamil doesn't have money to purchase one. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a laptop.

Jamil hopes to see his family live in better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Julian Jr.

texts.en:
His name is Julian. He is 37 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Maribel and they work very hard to sustain the family needs and business.

Julian operates a tricycle. His tricycle carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Silang, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 a day.

To help him continue his transport business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which he will use to pay for gas and maintenance of his tricycle. He is positive that this will boost his income as tricycle transportation is really a necessity in their place. Julian dreams of being successful in his business so he can give his family a much better life.

He aims to give the best to his wife. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married and has 2 kids, one of whom is going to school. Maria has her own house, but the place has no sewerage. She makes a living by making cheese. Her husband is a worker and travels a lot; for example, he is working in a mine now. Maria wants a loan to buy a milking cow, which will help her to sell more cheese and milk.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a hardworking man who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has a produce business, dealing mainly in selling beans, maize and nuts. His business dream is to have a well stocked, strong business that will see him attain more profits, though he complains of price fluctuations and high transport costs. 

Alex intends to use the loan to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is a hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop and farming to generate income. She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale shop, in spite of competition from neighbors. 

Madalena is asking for a loan to buy soap and sodas among others for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 5 Group

texts.en:
Jovanny is the co-ordinator of her group Fe y Amor 5 (Faith and Love). This group is based around the city of La Romana, an area where the economy centers around the sugar cane industry and in which there is limited access to running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Here, Jovanny makes her home as a single mother with her two children.

Jovanny has proven herself to be a reliable associate of Esperanza and this will be her eighth loan, after having paid back her previous loans without problems. She is excited to take this loan to continue developing her underwear clothing business. With this loan she will buy all kinds of women's and men's underwear to increase her inventory and to re-sell them. She hopes to use the profits to continue investing in her business and to provide her children with what they need. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear to re-sell.

loans.name: Korka's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.IL regroupe des membres qui habitent le même quartier et sont solidairement liés.

Korka qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est âgée de 47 ans,est mariée et mére de 03 enfants.

Elle a comme activité principale le commerce de tissus en wax,teintés et khartoum,elle a une bonne expérience pour les ventes de tissu.

Elle compte acheter avec l'argent du crédit du tissu teinté pour une somme de 800000f,tissu wax pour une valeur de 500000f et tissu khartoum pour une somme de 100000f,les frais de transport supportés se chiffrent à 18000f.

Son objectif est  de couvrir les frais de santé  de ses enfants,acheter le ravitaillement pour la nourriture de ses enfants et payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011. Members live in the same neighborhood and are interdependent.

Korka who is raising her arm on the right of the photo, is our featured borrower. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children.

Her main activity is trading wax, dyed and khartoum-style fabrics (colorful West-African fabrics). She has solid experience selling fabric.

She intends to use the loan money to buy dyed fabric for 800,000 francs, wax fabric for 500,000 francs and khartoum fabric for 100,000 francs. Transportation costs amount to 18,000 francs.

Her objective is to cover her children's medical expenses, buy food supplies for her children and pay their tuition fees.

loans.use: buy wax, dyed and khartoum-style fabrics (colorful West-African fabrics)

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old and works as a taxi driver. He is also he a sewer.

Juan needs a loan because he wants to reactivate his workshop. He will buy cloth, thread and other materials. He hopes he can get his workshop operating by the end of March, so that it will help improve his life quality. Juan is single and doesnt have anyone to count on so he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and materials.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 22-year-old single man from Deir El balah. He lives with his family in a very simple house. His father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Nidal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. By taking this loan, Nidal will be able to provide hot water for his family without using electricity.

Nidal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah used her previous loan to buy crafts to sell. She has continued with her craft business in addition to decorating at parties, plus hiring out traditional items for traditional functions. She faces the challenges of competition and limited capital. However, she hopes to have all her children educated to higher levels of learning. Sarah has requested a loan to buy beads and decorative cloth for her business.

loans.use: to buy beads and decorative cloth for her business.

loans.name: Estrudes Dolores

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ertrudes, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y fruto de relación tiene un hijo de 20 años, el cual este estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Estrudes es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo para así ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeño bar en donde vende bebidas como: gaseosas y aguas, también prepara y vende empanadas, hamburguesas, entre otros bocadillos, ella también está vendiendo ropa de todo tipo lo cual lo realiza puerta a puerta, ella recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días,  lleva más de 18 años dedicada en sus negocios con lo cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar: gaseosas, aguas y ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
In the 24 De Mayo canton of Manabí province, known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests and the diversity of animals, and friendly and hard-working people, the "Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor" loan group meets every fortnight. Here the people work in farming and cattle-raising.

And it is here that 58-year-old Estrudes lives. She is married and has one 20-year-old son with her husband. The couple's son is studying at university while Estrudes' husband is a businessman.

Estrudes is very hard-working and likes to earn her own living in order to help her husband with household costs. Estrudes has a small business, a bar where she sells fizzy drinks and water. She also prepares savoury pastries, hamburgers and other snacks. Estrudes makes a living selling all types of clothes door-to-door. She goes around the city selling her products on credit and collecting payments every week. Estrudes has had these businesses for 18 years and with them is able to earn a living.

This loan will be used to buy fizzy drinks, water and clothes. Estrudes has been with the loan group since the beginning and likes it because of the help she receives through loans. Estrudes' dream is to see her son become a professional.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, water and clothes.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a Mexican dairy farmer who lives from selling his cows' milk and cultivating corn. 

As the size of his herd was growing, it became increasingly difficult to manage their manure. Miguel used to pile it up outside his farm, where it was smelling bad, attracting flies and contaminating underground water sources. He also used to spend an important part of his income on the purchase of LP gas to cook and heat water in the house, as well as chemical fertilizers for his field. By investing in his biodigester, he is transforming these two operational challenges into an opportunity to become more self-sufficient. Indeed, he will be able to produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer by inputting his cows' waste in the biodigester, thereby also treating the waste. As he generates savings through the displacement of LP gas and chemical fertilizers, Miguel plans to buy more cows and a tractor. He also wants to improve the infrastructure on his farm and to save money to be able to send his children to university in the future (the youngest one is pictured with Miguel). Through the investment in the biodigester, Miguel's farm will become more cost-effective, productive and sustainable.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 36-year-old married woman and a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 18 and the youngest is 5. Her husband's occupation is a driver.

Evangeline is involved in farming. She toils the land and grows rice. To supplement her income, she also operates a motorcycle transport service. She is asking for a loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers. These materials will be beneficial in improving the yield of her farm. These could result in a bountiful harvest, and she would be able to sell large volumes of rice. In that way, Evangeline would start to handle her finances and start to set aside some of the profits for future use. She will be able to provide her family with proper diets.

Evangeline hopes that she has a great harvest for her to be able to have a sustainable source of income and help improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en: Maram is 19 years old and lives in Gaza with her family. She started her beauty salon business in 2010, and she has had good experience in this field. Her family’s house was affected in the last war in Gaza and was destroyed, so she asked Ryada for this loan to repair it again and help her family. She is trying now to take a step forward until she can back to her normal life. She wants to purchase cement and other building materials to rebuild the walls and install windows. Maram is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other building materials to rebuild the walls and install windows.

loans.name: Juana Lucelinda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijos dos de ellos son mayores de edad y estudian en universidad, mientras que los menores que son mellizos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es profesor de escuela.
Doña Juana es una mujer que le gusta a base de trabajo ganarse lo suyo y así ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres que a pesar de que es pequeña la tiene muy bien surtida, también se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), lo cual aun lo hace en su tienda y puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 que abre su tienda. Ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días pero solo los productos de Yanbal. 
Este crédito es para comprar: víveres para surtir su tienda, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
In the 24 De Mayo canton of Manabí province, known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests and the diversity of animals, and friendly and hard-working people, the "Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor" loan group meets every fortnight. Here the people work in farming and cattle-raising.

And it is here that 44-year-old Juana lives. She is married and has four children with her husband. Two of the children are now adults and study at university while the youngest are twins and are in school. Juana's husband is a school teacher.

Juana likes to work and earn her own living and thus help her husband with household costs and paying for their children's education. Juana has a small grocery store that is well stocked even though it is quite small. Juana also works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells Yanbal from her shop and door-to-door. Juana starts work at 7am when she opens her shop. She sells Yanbal products on credit and collects payment every eight days.

This loan will be used to buy supplies to stock up her shop, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. Juana has been with the loan group for five years and she likes it because, with the loans, she is able to move forward in life. Juana's dreams are to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar; tienen tres hijos, que viven con él.

Luis, se dedica a vender dulces, maní y agua de coco en las calles y en los buses.- Tiene más de 12 años de dedicándose al negocio.- Anteriormente, trabajaba en la agricultura, su hermano que ya trabajaba ese rubro y le enseño el oficio, con lo que trabajaba no le ajustaba para sustentar a su familia, por lo que decidió dedicarse a vender dulces.

El lugar donde trabaja está a un kilómetro y viaja en bicicleta, su esposa le ayuda a preparar el maní.
Él se levanta a trabajar a las cinco de la mañana y trabaja hasta las cinco de la tarde. 


Luis, quiere comprar más variedades de dulces, con las cuales podrá ampliar el negocio de ventas, y mejorar los ingresos económicos, para poder atraer mayor cantidad de clientes. De esta manera espera darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y esposa.

Luis, espera que su negocio crezca y en un futuro ampliarlo más; además, desea poder darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old and has a fifth grade education. He is married; his wife takes care of the household chores. The couple has three children who live at home.

Luis makes a living selling sweets, sweet peanuts and coconut water in the streets and on the buses. He has had this business for 12 years. Previously he worked in farming with his brother who taught him the trade. He could not, however, support his family with this work and so turned to his sweets business.

Luis' work is one kilometre from his home; he arrives there by bicycle. Luis' wife helps him to prepare the sweet peanuts.

Luis wakes up at 5am and works until 5pm.

Luis wants to buy a greater variety of sweets in order to increase his sales and income. With more sweets, Luis can attract more customers and hope to offer his wife and children a better life.

Luis hopes that his business will expand in the future. He would like to give his children the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of sweets.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en: Reyna is 30 years old and she sells bedsheets with her husband. She is the mother of four and they live in El Alto. Reyna works every day without rest. She needs a loan to buy a sewing machine to make their own bedsheets and sell them in many places because she is an experienced seamstress. In the future Reyna and her husband want to have a workshop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jeremyl

texts.en:
Jeremyl raises and sells hogs to earn a living. He is also a dealer of personal collection products like bathroom cleaner, powdered soap, kitchen utensils and many others. He is a married man with two children ages 10 and 6 years old. Together with his family, he lives in Talibon, Bohol.

Jeremyl has requested a loan to buy pig feed and additional capital to purchase personal collection products. These will be essential to improve the way he raises hogs and for him to be able to purchase more supplies to resell. With these, he could now earn big and be able to settle his obligations. He could now start to provide the basic needs of his family.

In the future, he is hopeful that, with the additional capital, he could manage both of his sources of income successfully for the improvement of his livelihood and also for the welfare of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional capital to purchase personal collection products

loans.name: Wendel

texts.en:
Wendel is driven by passion in selling. He is 48 years old, single, and lives on the island of Siquijor. He runs a store that primarily supports his family. Everyday, he never get tired of tending his store. 

Wendel is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He religiously repaid his obligations without record of default. Now, he has borrowed another loan to pay for sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell. Having enough products to sell would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 47 years old, and is separated with three children. They live in Maloro, Tangub in the Philippines. 

In order to survive, as the breadwinner, she is engaged in selling dried fish in order to sustain their needs. She started up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. Her business has operated for three years already. Now, she is planning to borrow  PHP 40,000 from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2011 to purchase more varieties and stock of dried fish to sell. She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. 

Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties and stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, es un señora soltera, únicamente vive con su nieto; desde hace más de 13 años tiene por negocio la venta de comida y meriendas típicas, lo hace en un horario de 9:00 a.m. a 7:30 p.m., el negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona comercial de la ciudad, por el momento no representa dificultades y lo aprendió dentro de su familia.
Invertirá en una arrocera, un juego de cocina, granos básicos, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, etc., equipara su cocina y tendrá materia prima para elaborar la comida, incrementara la productividad, tendrá clientes satisfechos y su situación financiera se estabilizara.
Su visión es dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, mantener su negocio en el mercado para heredarle a su familia un patrimonio y continuar teniendo ingresos para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is single and lives with her grandson. For more than 13 years she has had a business selling typical meals and snacks from 9am until 7.30pm. This business is located in an area of the city that has a lot of businesses. For the moment, Mercedes has no problems with the business. She learned the trade from her family.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy a rice cooker, kitchen appliances, basic grains, vegetables, condiments, drinks and more to set up her kitchen and to have the basic ingredients for preparing meals. This will increase Mercedes' productivity and she will have satisfied customers and a more stable financial situation.

Mercedes wants to give her customers good service and keep her business afloat so that she can pass it on to somebody in her family. She also wants to keep earning an income in order to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy a rice cooker, kitchen appliances, basic grains, vegetables, condiments, drinks and more to set up her kitchen and to have the basic ingredients for preparing meals.

loans.name: Jose Ivan

texts.es:
José, de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, tiene un hijo  de 2 años de edad.

José, tiene 6 años de trabajar la agricultura, pero además de ese trabajo, su tío le enseño todo lo relacionado a la peluquería; José, por las mañanas se dedica a realizar las labores del campo y por la tarde trabaja en su peluquería, de esta manera el obtiene los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su familia.

José, necesita el crédito para sembrar granos básicos, ya que tiene un terreno preparado con sistema de riego y necesita cultivarlo.

José, sueña con cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, para poder obtener mejores ingresos  y también poder invertir en la peluquería.- También, desea ayudar a su mama y a su hija para que pueda estudiar.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old and has a ninth grade education. He has a partner, and a two-year-old child.

José has been working in farming for six years. In addition, his aunt has trained him to be a hairdresser. In the morning, José works in the fields and, in the afternoon, works at his hairdressing salon. He can thus earn the necessary money to support his family.

José needs this loan in order to buy basic grains. He has an irrigation system prepared and needs to grow his crops.

José dreams of growing corn on 21,000 square metres of land in order to earn a higher income. He also wants to invest in his hairdressing salon. José would to like help his mother, and help his daughter to study.

loans.use: to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 34-year-old who lives in Gaza with his wife and three children. His wife is unemployed, and he is an employee at a private institution. His house was fully destroyed by the last war in Gaza.

The goal of the loan will be to buy construction tools, since these are important for him to mend the damage and to be able pay for the workers; that small amount will help him to start and get his house again.

Wisam hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family and provide his family the best living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and pay for the workers.

loans.name: Shahrayar

texts.en:
Shahrayar is a 19-year-old single man from Bethlehem city. He lives with his parents and nine brothers and sisters in a small simple house. Three of his brothers work and support the family but their income is not enough to cover all their needs. Shahrayar works selling corn using a stall. It is a good business and the demand is high. Shahrayar would like to help his younger brother to start his own business.

Shahrayar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy another food stall for his brother to sell corn in. By taking this loan, Shahrayar will be able to provide his family with another source of income.

Shahrayar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy another food stall for his brother to sell corn in.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Cusco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO.

La socia María Cleofe tiene 01 hijo tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Este crédito pertenece a  una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es crediyapa.

Los demás socios se dedican a la tienda de abarrotes, salón de belleza.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
María Cleofe belongs to the "Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco" communal bank.

María is 50 years old and has one son. She has a partner. As well as looking after the home, María has had a grocery shop for some time now. It is going well thanks to her determination. María would like to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

María is applying for a loan in order to buy rice, sugar and other items.

María is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

This loan is part of a series of loans at Asociación Arariwa, and is called a "Crediyapa" loan.

The other members of this group work have beauty salons and grocery shops.

The members appearing in the attached photos were unable to attend to be in the main photo as they were working.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and more.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Juan Carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de confección de muebles, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de confeccion de muebles. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar melanina.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juan Carlos continues to work at his furniture-making business. Through this business he wants to help his children to get ahead. Juan Carlos' dream is to expand his business.
