She has been selling condiments and cereals for eight years. She buys her supplies at the big market in her district.
She would like to buy five sacks of gumbo and three of fresh condiments.
Mrs. S. Marie wants to reinvest the profits in her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy three bags of beans, five bags of millet and some condiments.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Сафаргул проживает на районе Шахритус. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем, но ее муж находится заграницей. Он гастарбайтер в Российской Федерации. У Сафаргул двое детей им по 3 месяца. 
   В течение трех лет Сафаргул занимается земледелием. Эту деятельность она освоила благодаря своему тестю. Сафаргул приносит в дом доход за счет растениеводческой деятельности. Как и многие жители Сафаргул уже закончила посев урожая и ей остается всего обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Но для приобретения минеральных удобрений у нее не хватает денежных средств и Сафаргул обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Safargul lives in the Shahrituz District. She is 27 years old. She is married, but her husband lives abroad. He is a labor migrant in the Russian Federation. Safargul has two children who are both 3 months old.

For the past three years, Safargul has practiced crop farming. She learned this business thanks to her father-in-law. Safargul brings home an income from her agricultural business. Like many of her fellow villagers, Safargul has already finished sowing her crops. All she has left to do is cultivate the land with mineral fertilizers so that she can receive a large, high-quality harvest. However, she does not have enough money to buy the mineral fertilizers, which is why she requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is single young man who is very hard working. For the last year he has been buying energy saving jikos (stoves) and selling them at a profit.

Erick has applied for his first loan of KES 7,000 from VisionFund Kenya and he will use the entire loan amount to buy more energy saving jikos to sell.

Erick hopes to grow his business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy energy saving jikos (stoves)

loans.name: Salah Eddin

texts.en:
Salah Eddin is a 21-year-old single man from Rafah city. Salah is a university student specializing in Elementary education. 

Salah's father works as an employee at a local firm where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Salah would like to take his BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future to help his family with part of their expenses.

Salah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Salah will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

Salah appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Luisa Iveth

texts.es:
Luisa, utilizo el crédito anterior para mejorar la venta de artículos de uso doméstico, su familia tiene un mejor nivel de vida, sus situación financiera está mejorando y  cancelo sus deudas.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito para poder comprar bolsas plásticas, pastas dentales, detergentes, etc., así entregara sus pedidos en el tiempo justo y tendrá clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Luisa used the previous loan to improve sales of household items. Her family now have better living standards, her financial situation is improving, and she has paid off her debts.

She has decided on a new loan to buy plastic bags, toothpastes, detergents etc. This will mean that she can deliver orders on time, and will have satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, toothpastes, detergents etc., so that she can deliver orders on time, and will have satisfied customers.

loans.name: Omer**. Group

texts.en:
This group is called Omer**. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER From AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children, living with her family in a very old house. She works as a teacher with a small salary. 

The renovation of the house costs to a lot of money and her salary is not enough to do it. Fatima applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and iron to make the necessary renovation to the house.  

Fatima hopes to build a new house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and iron  to make the necessary renovation to the house.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a rice farmer who grows and sells rice. She also operates a motorcycle transport service. Felicitas is married and she and her husband have six children. Their oldest is 17 and their youngest is 11 months old. Felicitas hails from Talibon, Bohol. 

Felicitas is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for farm laborers. Her loan will help improve her farming business because she will be able to harvest a higher volume of rice with a resulting change in income. Felicitas hopes that she will expand her current sources of income to support the needs of her growing children and become sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 51-year-old widow from Ormoc City, Leyte. For more than 10 years, she has been raising hogs. 

Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed.  Her loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as increase her income. In the future, Beatriz dreams of expanding her hog raising venture to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is married and runs a second-hand clothing business where people come to shop every day. She has been in business since 2011 and feels comfortable running her business. Rita earns money every day. Her business has made her independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family.

Rita is requesting an 800 USD loan to buy some additional supplies such as shirts, trousers, and shorts. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, and shorts

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is now 54 years old, and she used her previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy animal feed and a dairy cow. It was profitable and she successfully repaid the loan.

She will be using this loan to buy dairy feed for her dairy cows. These will enable her to get more milk for her supply and make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more dairy cows.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene  70 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad  e independientes. Su no trabaja por la edad.
Doña Carmen es una muy buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para así lograr sus recursos y con estos poder salir adelante, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual se dedica a la cría de pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende por libras a vecinos de sus localidad o entrega en el mercado a comerciantes en este lugar, con esto ella se gana lo suyo que les sirve para salir adelante junto a su marido.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the 24 de Mayo Canton in the Manabí Province, known for its beautiful landscapes, forests, variety of fauna and for its friendly and hardworking farmers and ranchers, the credit group Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor meet every fortnight.

Carmen lives in this area, she is 70 years old, married, and has four independent, adult children from this relationship. Her husband doesn't work due to his age.

Carmen is a good wife, who likes to work so she can gain the resources to get ahead. She has a small farm in which she rears chickens. She buys the animals when they are small, rears them for three or four months until they are the appropriate weight, and then sells them by weight to the local people or delivers them to local traders at the market. This way, she earns what her and her husband need to move forward.

She will use this loan to buy chickens, as well as food and medicine so that they can grow well. She has been a member since this credit group started, which she likes as it helps her with loans. Her dream is to stay healthy in order to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy chickens, as well as food and medicine for chickens.

loans.name: Shirley Milagros

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive con su esposo en casa propia en una comunidad en el distrito de CayaltÍ, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio. y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en su propio domicilio. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercaderia como arroz, azúcar, entre otros, para poder aumentar el stock de su negocio. De esta manera Shirley espera satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y hacer crecer más su negocio, con lo cual logrará obtener más ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Shirley is 30 years old and has a domestic companion. She lives with her partner in her own house in the community of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the Northern coast of Peru. The population of the district works mainly in agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. She works selling grocery store items such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, among others. Her business is located in her own house. She has more than 5 years experience in the business with very good personal and work references in her district. She is requesting a loan to buy a larger amount of merchandise such as rice, sugar, among others, in order to increase the stock of her business. In this way she hopes to satisfy the preferences and needs of her customers and make her business grow. With this she will get more income and be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of merchandise such as rice, sugar, among others, in order to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona muy extrovertida y entusiasta con su trabajo, él vive en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene 52 años de edad. 

Miguel, le encanta trabajar la agricultura, él desde pequeño se familiarizo con su trabajo, pero no contaba con suficiente capital para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de su siembra, un día se acerco a la institución ADICLA, para obtener información sobre  cómo se pueda aplicar a un crédito, se convenció y obtuvo el primer crédito, ahora Miguel necesita de un segundo préstamo, dándole el mismo uso, la expectativa de Miguel es conseguir el préstamo para ir comprando lo necesario para su cultivo, para que pueda tener una buena cosecha y generar ganancias para mantener a su familia,  él  solo depende de ese trabajo pero  con la ayuda de Dios siempre ha salido avante con sus cosechas.

El sueño de Miguel es conseguir el préstamo para seguir con su agricultura, ya que le encanta estará convivir con la naturaleza.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very extroverted person, enthusiastic about his work. He lives in the community of Sololá and is 52 years old. 

Miguel loves to work in agriculture. Since was little, he was familiar with his work, but he didn't have enough capital to purchase the supplies to maintain his crop. One day, he approached ADICLA to get information about how he could apply for a loan. He was convinced and got his first loan. Now, Miguel needs a second loan, giving it the same use. Miguel's expectation is to get a loan to purchase what is necessary for his crop, to be able to have a good harvest and generate earnings to maintain his family. He only depends on this work, but with the help of God, he has always gotten ahead with his harvests. 

Miguel's dream is to get a loan to continue with his farming, since he loves to coexist with nature.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and organic manure.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 52-year-old sari-sari (variety) store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has three dependents. Editha has been running her store for more than five years now and she sells various goods and food items to people in her neighborhood. 

Editha is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, snack foods and other items. Her loan will enable her to increase her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.  In the future, Editha hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, toiletries, condiments, snack foods and other items

loans.name: Patricia Evangelina

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene  53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad  y el menor tiene 17 años el cual  es discapacitado, una de los mayores estudia en universidad. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Patricia es una muy buena madre y esposa que hace lo necesario para darles a su familia lo mejor, ella  tiene un salón de belleza, allí realiza tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros trabajos. Trabaja todos los días  desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Además en su negocio tiene dos vitrinas en las cuales vende ropa y productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), y tratamientos de belleza el cual lo hace al mismo  tiempo cuando realiza sus otros trabajos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes ropa de todo tipo y productos Belcorp.  Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde hace 6 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan en el grupo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Madre para un Futuro Mejor Communal Bank meets every two weeks in 24 de Mayo Canton in the province of Manabí.  The canton is known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, the variety of fauna, and its friendly and hardworking people, who work in farming and ranching.

Patricia, 53, lives here.  She's married and they have three children: two adults, one of whom attends college, and a 17-year-old who is handicapped.  Her husband's a driver.

Patricia's a very good mother and wife who does what's necessary to give her family the best.  She has a beauty salon where she offers dyes, haircuts, nail polishing, and other services.  She works every day from 8 a.m. until 2 p.m., and sometimes later if her customers need her services.  She also has two display cases where she sells clothing and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories), and beauty treatments that she gives at the same time as her other tasks.

She's going to use this loan to buy dyes, permanents, all types of clothing, and Belcorp products.

She has been in the communal bank for six years and she likes it because of the help the group receives.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents, all types of clothing, and Belcorp products

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad reconocida por la producción de caña y la siembra de cultivos alternativos como el hule y limón se formó el grupo llamado "La Alegría". Cada una de las personas que conforman el grupo desempeñan una actividad para brindar mejores oportunidades a sus familias, ellas son:

Reyna B., Paulina - Venta de Tamales 
Rosa - Venta de Abarrotes Y Verduras
Zulamita, Andrea, Reyna H., Teresa - Venta de Abarrotes 
Martha- Perfumes
Judith- Zapatos

Doña Rosa es una mujer emprendedora quien formó una familia con el señor Felipe, sus seis hijos ya son mayores de edad. 

La tienda de abarrotes de doña Rosa fue la primera en la localidad y desde hace 10 años le ha facilitado a sus clientes el acceso a bienes de consumo básico. Recuerda que ella misma tenía que caminar 10 minutos y esperar a la orilla de la carretera un taxi colectivo o autobús; el viaje era largo, pero ella hizo algo para cambiar la situación. 

La tienda la inició con algunos kilos de frijol, azúcar, queso y sopa, pero con sus ganancias y los créditos que ha solicitado, poco a poco su inventario fue aumentando. Actualmente necesita comprar más sopa, arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, queso, huevos, chile, cebolla, jitomate, maíz, galletas y refrescos que es lo que más consumen sus clientes. 

Rosa está muy satisfecha con su negocio ya que demás de obtener ganancias ocupa su tiempo en algo productivo y no descuida a su familia. Dentro de sus planes a futuro se encuentran el establecer un local más amplio pese a que muy cerca hay dos tiendas más. Para atraer a más clientes, Rosa siempre busca tener variedad de productos en sus tienda, ofrecer un trato amable y atender a las personas incluso si la buscan después de las 8 de la noche que es la hora de cierre. “Sé bien que mi tienda no es un centro comercial, pero cubre las necesidades de mis clientes”. Rosa agradece la oportunidad de obtener un nuevo préstamo para mantener su actividad. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Teresa, doña Rosa viste blusa y falda en color rosa.
texts.en:
In a community known for its sugar cane production and growing alternative crops such as rubber trees and lemons, a group called "La Alegría" was formed. Each one of the people who make up this group works in a job to offer better opportunities to her family. They are:

Reyna B., Paulina - tamale sales 
Rosa - grocery and vegetable sales
Zulamita, Andrea, Reyna H., Teresa - grocery sales 
Martha- perfumes
Judith- shoes

Rosa is a very enterprising woman who formed a family with Felipe; their six children are now adults.

Rosa's grocery store was the first in the area and for the past 10 years, she has helped her customers access basic consumer goods. She remembers that she had to walk 10 minutes and wait for a shared taxi or bus at the side of the highway. The trip was long, and she did something to change the situation. 

She began the store with a few kilos of beans, sugar, cheese, and soup, but with her earnings and the loans that she has requested, little by little her inventory has expanded. Currently, she needs to purchase more soup, rice, beans, oil, sugar, cheese, eggs, chilies, onions, tomatoes. corn, cookies and soft drinks, which is what her customers consume the most. 

Rosa is very satisfied with her business since in addition to getting earnings, she keeps busy with something productive and doesn't neglect her family. Among her plans for the future are establishing a larger retail space despite there being two other stores very close by. To attract more customers, Rosa always looks to have a variety of products in her store, offer them friendly service, and to serve people even if they come looking for her after 8:00 at night, which is the time she closes. "I well know that my store is not a commercial center, but it meets the needs of my customers." Rosa is grateful for the opportunity to get a new loan to maintain her work. 

*The photo was taken at Teresa's house. Rosa is dressed in a pink blouse and skirt.

loans.use: to purchase soup, rice, beans, oil, sugar, cheese, eggs, chilies, onions, tomatoes, corn, cookies and soft drinks.

location.town: Localidad Corrales, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa Oaxa

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 35 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Katipunan, Plaridel. For the past five years, Julie has had been a farmer. She earns 15,000 PHP from each crop on her rice farm. 

Julie became an active member of PMPC in 2013. She is now requesting a 9,500 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to have a healthier and higher crop yield on her rice farm. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to improve the general living conditions of her family and provide her parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a healthier and higher crop yield on her rice farm.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon tiene 50 años de edad, es casado. Vive con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura y la ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Ramon cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercaderia para su negocio, con ello Ramon podrá satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, aumentando su nivel de ingresos y así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ramon is 50 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two young children in his own house, made of rustic material, in the rural part of the district of Pucara, province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca, in the Northern Andean region of Peru. The work activities in this district are agriculture and animal husbandry. He works selling groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, among others. His store is located in his house. Ramon has very good personal and work references in the area. He will use this loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for his store. With it, Ramon will be able to satisfy the likes and needs of his customers, increasing his level of income. This way he will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 24-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of three daughters. Issa works as a farmer on the family land, where he plants seasonal crops. He is also a university student specializing in business administration. He would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future to improve his family's living conditions. 

Issa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Issa will be able to do his home work and write reports easily. Issa appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old single man from Deir al-Balah. Three years ago, Ahmad opened a grocery store in the city where he sells basic grocery products and kid's candy. It is a good business but still needs some improvements.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha (a non-interest-bearing loan) loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more grocery items like sugar and rice to resell them in his grocery store.  By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his sales and also his income.  Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like sugar and rice to resell them in his grocery store

loans.name: Wattu Group

texts.fr:
Wattu est le nom donné à  un groupe de crédit qui vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit. Il se compose de 05 membres dont trois femmes et deux hommes.
La présidente s’appelle Soukèye, âgée de 27 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Elle a suivi une formation en comptabilité gestion pendant 3 ans et comme elle n’a pas encore trouvé quelque chose, elle a ouvert une boutique mini-service il y a juste 3 mois. C’est dans le cadre d’améliorer son activité, qu’elle a intégré ce groupe pour bénéficier d’un crédit. Elle pourra donc acheter des cartes de crédit, des fournitures scolaires, faire des traitements de texte et du transfert d’argent. Concernant cette activité, elle paie le loyer et l’électricité, mais grâce aux recettes de l’activité, elle s’en sort pas mal car elle peut avoir une recette journalière de 15 000f.
Soukèye développe un projet, celui de hisser son activité à un plus haut niveau. Elle veut aussi continuer à encadrer ce groupe de crédit et souhaite avoir un appui en matériel pour des activités communes dans le quartier.
texts.en:
Wattu is the name of a credit group asking for a very first loan. The group is made up of five members of which three women and two men.
The president is called Soukeye and is 27 years old and married without children. She has a three-year training in accounts management and as she has not yet found a job, three months ago she opened a mini-service shop. She joined this group to qualify for a loan to improve her business. The loan will enable her to buy credit cards, school material, and to do word processing and money transfers. As for her business she pays the rent and the electricity bills, but thanks to the profits she is doing quite well as she can make up to 15 000f a day.
Soukeye is working on a project to raise her business to the highest standards. She would also like to continue managing this credit group and hopes to obtain equipment for communal activities in her district.

loans.use: to buy credit cards, school material for resale and to do word processing and money transfers.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 53 years old and married. She is a resident of Usocan, Plaridel, Philippines, and her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to public market or to their neighbors. Meriam and her husband have been in this business for many years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself by purchasing fish in bulk to resell at market. Last May 14, 2012, Meriam and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan to buy fishing nets. Aside from receiving financial assistance, they also enjoyed the add-on benefits such as insurance and savings.  

Meriam is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more fish to sell. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help and the patience and diligence of her husband, she will become a successful vendor someday and be able to own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 56 years old and married with five children. She lives with her family in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Luzminda and her husband have a fishing business and own also own fish cages. She earns a meager monthly income doing this type of work which supports the needs of their family, especially her children's education through graduation. 

Luzminda is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase additional floating guards and other fishing accessories to improve and expand her fish cages. In the future, she hopes to build a decent house for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase floating guards and other accessories to improve and expand her fish cages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an amount of clothes to resell alongside  selling sweets and ice cream

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr: Madame BASHOMBE est cliente du groupe UKWELI où elle occupe le poste de présidente. Mariée à un infirmier et mère de 7 enfants, à l’âge de 45 ans, elle s’occupe de la vente des souliers, activité entreprise depuis 1999 suite au premier soutien de son mari. Le prêt sollicité lui permettra d’acquérir 20 paires de souliers dans le but de d’agrandir son entreprise et de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants dans les jours à venir. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour le soutien indéfectible qu’elle apporte aux femmes à faibles revenus.
texts.en: Bashombe is a client of the UKWELI group where she hold the position of president. She is married to a nurse and is a mother of 7 children. At the age of 45, she is in charge of shoe sales, a business started in 1999 following initial support from her husband. The loan requested will help her purchase 20 pairs of shoes, with the goal of extending her business, as well as to pay her children's school fees in the coming days. She thanks Hekima for the unfailing support for women with low incomes.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma engages in fishing. She catches and sells crabs. She is 49 years old and is a married woman with twelve children from Talibon, Bohol. Six of her children are still attending school. Her husband earns a living by fishing and he is also a carpenter.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like a fishing net and crab trap. These will help Gemma improve her on-going catch. She could could now continue her fishing livelihood that will surely ensure she gets higher earnings. She could then prepare healthy diets and provide better living conditions.

In the future, Gemma is determined to successfully manage her resources well for the welfare of her own children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net and crab trap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement and wood to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flagstones to renovate the floor of the living room of his house.

loans.name: Las Cuatas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de Veracruz, la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a trabajar en el campo, sembrando, cortando, acarreando caña o picando y recolectando hule de los árboles, mientras que muchos otros tienen pequeños negocios para obtener sus ingresos, tal es el caso de los integrantes del grupo Las Cuatas: 

Gloria -Abarrotes
Yennsy -Ropa	
Victoria -Antojitos	
Piedad -Tamales	
Flora -Cosmético
Gertrudis -Ropa
Nidia -Ropa

Doña Gloria es una mujer muy comprometida consigo misma, tiene 42 años de edad y está casada con Juan José. Ellos tienen un hijo que estudia en la telesecundaria en la comunidad. Desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a vender abarrotes adecuando un espacio en su casa con ayuda de su esposo, la actividad la inició con el firme propósito de apoyar con los gastos de la casa. Anteriormente, el acceso a la comunidad era muy restringido, fue entonces cuando nació su negocio facilitando a sus clientes el acceso a la mercancía. Los precios, el surtido y el trato a sus clientes es lo que hace que su negocio continúe activo.

Hace poco menos de un año, Gloria incorporó algunos productos de papelería a su tienda ya que noto que la única tienda de este tipo en la comunidad tiene horarios muy limitados. Ahora sus vecinos también pueden comprar hojas blancas, lápiz, lapiceros, corrector, plumones, libretas, cartulinas, papel bond, pegamento, marca texto y diurex  siendo esta la mercancía de mayor demanda por los estudiantes.

Ahora necesita invertir nuevamente un poco de capital en la tienda de abarrotes ya que quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijol, maíz, sopa, atún, galletas, café, leche, harina, chiles enlatados, galletas, dulces, refrescos que son los productos que más vende. 

*La fotografía tomada en casa de Yenssy, doña Gloria viste pesquero café y blusa verde.
texts.en:
In the community of Veracruz, the majority of the inhabitants work in the fields, planting, cutting, hauling cane or tapping and harvesting rubber from the trees, while many others have small businesses to get their income. This is the case with the members of the Las Cuatas group:

Gloria - groceries
Yennsy - clothing	
Victoria - snacks	
Piedad - tamales	
Flora - cosmetics
Gertrudis - clothing
Nidia - clothing

Gloria is a woman who is very committed to herself. She is 42 years old and is married to Juan José. They have a child who attends the secondary education distance learning program in his community. For the past 20 years, she has worked selling groceries, outfitting a space in her house with her husband's help. She began the work with the strong purpose of helping with the household expenses. Previously, access to the community was very limited, it was then that her business was born, helping her customers access merchandise. The prices, assortment and customer service are what make her business continue.

A little less than a year ago, Gloria included some paper goods in her store since she noticed that the only store of this kind had very limited hours. Some of her neighbors also can purchase sheets of paper, pencils, pencil cases, white out, pens, notebooks, cardboard, bond paper, glue, highlighters, and tape, these being the merchandise in highest demand by the students. 

Now she needs to invest a little capital in her grocery store again, since she wants to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, corn, soup, tuna, cookies, coffee, milk, flour, canned chilies, cookies, sweets, and soft drinks, which are the products that she sells the most. 

*The photo was taking in Yenssy's house. Gloria is wearing brown capris and a green blouse.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, oil, milk, eggs, ham, sausages, cheese, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is married and he has five children. Willy is in the public transportation business, and he starts his job very early in the morning. His wife helps the family as a seamstress. 

Willy needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle and to buy new tires. Willy would want to have his own house in the future to give to his family more comfort. 

Willy appears in the picture with his wife and in their current home. The wife is showing some of her work.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle and to buy new tires

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz vive en unión libre y tiene 1 hijo a quien le garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual intenta generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente, junto con su compañero, para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una vida plena. 

Desde hace más de unos meses comenzó con gran esfuerzo un negocio de papelería y venta de variedades en un local ubicado en el municipio de La Dorada.

 Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Luz busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de papelería y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.

Con este préstamo la actividad de Luz tendrá un gran impulso pues mejorara su inventario y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Luz lives in a common-law relationship and has one son, whom she ensures a good quality of life thanks to her business.  She expects to earn the income to contribute financially so she and her husband improve the economic situation in their home and have a full life.

More than a few months ago, she made the effort to start a business selling paper and sundries in a retail space in the town of La Dorada.

Her clientele is increasing and they're requesting more products all the time, so Luz is requesting a loan to buy paper products to sell a wider variety of products in her business.

This loan will give Luz's business a big boost because she'll improve her inventory and her sales.

loans.use: to buy paper supplies

loans.name: Maribel Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Maribel, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 15 y 6 años de edad, los cuales estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Maribel es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos colaborar con los gastos que generan la educación de sus hijos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad dos o tres días a la semana más que todo por las tardes o noches  ya que en la mañana también vende periódicos en el centro de la ciudad, actividad con la cual se gana algo que le sirve para salir adelante junto a su familia, lleva 2 años en este negocio y con la venta de periódicos mas de 15 años.
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar periódicos, pantalones, camisas y otras prendas. Lleva 1 año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the 24 De Mayo canton, Manabí province, known for its lovely landscape, for its forests, variety of fauna and for its friendly and hard-working people who work in agriculture and animal husbandry, the Madre Para un Futuro Mejor communal bank group meets every two weeks. 

In this place, Maribel lives. She is 38 years old, married and from this relationship they have three children, ages 19, 15, and 6, who are students at the university, secondary school and primary school. Her husband is a driver.

Maribel is a very good mother and housewife who, to get her own resources and with this help with the expenses generated by her children's education, works in sales. She sells all sorts of clothing, and sells door-to-door and by orders. She goes out to make her rounds through the locality two or three days per week, mostly in the afternoons and evenings, and in the morning she also sells newspapers in the city center, work with which she earns something that helps her get ahead with her family. She has had this business for two years and selling newspapers for more than 15 years. 

This loan will be used to purchase newspapers, pants, shirts, and other clothing. She has been with the communal bank group for one year and she likes it because with the loans she improves her business. Her dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase newspapers, pants, shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera. Vive en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y la ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en general, con experiencia en el rubro, con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para su negocio y poder satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo cual le generará mayores ingresos y así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Agripina, 54, is single.  She lives in her own home, made of rustic material, in the Pucará district of the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru.  The community in this district works mainly in farming and ranching.

She earns a living selling a variety of vegetables and has experience in the job and very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan is to buy a large amount of merchandise for her business so she can satisfy her customers' tastes and needs.

This will generate more income for her as well as improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rock Of Ages 2 Group

texts.en:
These five members of the Rock of Ages 2 Group are, on average, 39 years old with two children. They all live in Chorkor, Accra and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities. Group members are retail traders of electronics, underwear, pastries and phone cards. 

In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with ID Ghana. They are on their second group loan cycle with ID Ghana. Ebenezer (the man standing second from right in the photo) sells phone cards. He intends to use his loan to buy different network phone cards in Accra, and sell them to his customers. He is married with one dependent child, and hopes to attain a good profit with this loan, to be reinvested in the business, and also to support his wife in taking care of their child.

loans.use: To buy different network phone cards in Accra and sell them to his customers.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married  man and has been blessed with five children. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. He cites theft and competition as his major challenge in his business. 

Francis is requesting for 20,000 KES to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil for his shop. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil for his shop.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man; he has one kid who still attends school. He lives at his house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces challenges of competition and seasonality in his business. 

With the Kshs 50,000, he wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas, and green vegetables to sell. 

He dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman; she has five kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 10 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Litzen

texts.en:
Litzen has a boyfriend who lives with her. She is a mother of two children; one of them is going to school. Litzen has her own house that was inherited by her parents, and she and her family live in Achacachi. Litzen's house has a little grocery store that she tends. Litzen's boyfriend is a school teacher.

Litzen needs a loan to buy products to increase her offerings at the grocery store (soft drinks, rice, noodles, bread, etc.). Litzen appreciates that her case was taken into consideration to be on the Kiva website, and she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to increase her offerings at the grocery store (soft drinks, rice, noodles, bread, etc.).

loans.name: For Christ Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “For Christ” group from Chorkor, Accra, a city in Greater Accra region of Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to the microfinance institution, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a total loan amount of 2,700 GHS. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. The group is involved in selling porridge, smoked fish, cooked rice and stew, and groceries.

Comfort is the featured borrower of this group. The 33-year-old is married and has two children. Comfort has sold smoked fish for 2 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy one carton of fish and firewood to smoke and sell to customers. This will help her improve the business and family life.

loans.use: to buy one carton of fish and firewood to smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies such as cement and bricks to build an extra room in the yard of his house to expand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials as cement and wood to renovate the house

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan, 30, is married with three school-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 4 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children and their health needs. 

She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her family. She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase additional stocks and now she is re-applying a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dalmacio

texts.en:
Dalmacio is a a hardworking widower who is always out in the streets to sell his fish. He is very diligent and determined fish vendor and he works as twice as hard so he can sustain his needs. He is from Usocan, Plaridel, 

Dalmacio has applied for his membership with PMPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. Dalmacio is in need of capital to purchase more fish to sell. He asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 12,000 and he is thankful to them for financing his capital needs. In addition, he wants to expand his business and to manage it well for his loyal customers. 

Dalmacio deeply wishes that someday, he could own a space where he can display his fish.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is managing her food vending business in Usocan, Plaridel, Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. It has been doing well and supports the needs of the family. 

Rosa has local customers and also accepts orders for additional income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to be able to open a spacious restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her food vending business.

loans.name: Viviana Jessenia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Viviana,  tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, de 12, 11 y 8  años de edad, todos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Viviana es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo ya que su marido no gana mucho e su trabajo, así ellos salen adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y zapatos. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante en su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the 24 De Mayo canton, Manabí province, known for its lovely landscape, for its forests, variety of fauna and for its friendly and hard-working people who work in agriculture and animal husbandry, the Madre Para un Futuro Mejor communal bank group meets every two weeks. 

Viviana lives in this place. She is 28 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has three children, ages 12, 11, and 8.  All of them are students in secondary or primary school. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Viviana is a very determined woman who likes to independently get ahead and, with her income, help her partner with the household expenses. She works in sales. She sells all sorts of clothing and shoes and sells door-to-door and also from her house, where her customers come. She leaves the items with her customers on credit, and collects each week. She has been working for more than 4 years in this job, which allows her to earn something since her husband doesn't earn much in his work. In this way, they get ahead. 

This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, blouses and shoes. She has been in the communal bank group for 5 loan cycles and she likes it for the loans that allow her to get ahead with her business. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses and shoes.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
Medardo tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se realizan en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente a la destilación de aguardiente, aprovechando los cultivos de caña de azúcar que posee. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de materia prima para su negocio, así como para la reparación de los equipos que usa para la destilación de la caña de azúcar. Con esta inversión Medardo espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio, con esto logrará aumentar su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Medardo is 58 years old. He lives with his life partner and a son in the Pucará district of the province of Jaén, located in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru.The main work activities in the area are agriculture and ranching.

Medardo works in agriculture, mainly the production of aguardiente [distilled spirits], making the most of his sugarcane crop. He has over ten years of experience in this work, and very good personal and work references.

This loan is buy more raw materials for his business as well as to repair the equipment he uses for sugarcane distillation.

With this inversion, Medardo is looking to improve productivity and increase income, and as a result enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials as well as to repair the equipment he uses for sugarcane distillation.

loans.name: Top Class Group

texts.en:
Top Class is a group that lives in Accra-Chorkor, located in coastal Ghana. The group was formed to take loans to enable them to stay in active businesses. They are into cosmetics, general goods, soft drinks, wigs, underwear, materials and groceries, and they have been successfully running these small businesses. They have taken three loans and are now on their fourth loan cycle. 

The featured borrower is Gifty, who is 34 years old and into the sale of soft drinks and wigs. She has been doing this business for 11 years. Her previous loan repayments have been successful. She is married with one dependent child. She is requesting this loan to buy drinks and wigs to sell to her customers. 

The group would need a total amount of GHS 12,200 to buy enough goods and serve customers better. Her colleague will do the same, and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks and wigs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Carloman

texts.es:
Jose tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero. Tiene un hogar estable al lado de sus padres y su hermano mayor, viven en casa familiar de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Este distrito es una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimor, cuenta con un terreno agrícola propio donde está ubicada su parcela de café. Esta actividad la realiza hace 04 años, contando con experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno. El destino del crédito será para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con ello Jose espera tener una mayor y mejor producción para las próximas campañas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, age 25, is single.  He has a stable household, living with his parents and his older brother.  They live in the family house made of basic materials in the rural part of the Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  This district is a small community that devotes itself basically to agriculture and livestock.

He grows the Catimor variety of coffee.  He has his own agricultural land where his coffee crops are.  He has been engaged in this business activity for four years, and he has experience doing this.  He also raises cattle.  

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and compost for the maintenance of his crop.  With this Jose hopes to have a greater and better production for the upcoming seasons.  Then he will have better earnings in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for the maintenance of his crop.

loans.name: Britaldo

texts.es:
Britaldo tiene 47 años de edad, es casado. Vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive Britaldo es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos, entre otros productos. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para su negocio, con esto Britaldo busca aumentar el stock de productos de su tienda para poder satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Esta inversión le permitirá mayores ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Britaldo is 47 years old and married.  He lives with his wife in his own house made from basic materials in the Quercotillo district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  The community where Britaldo lives is a small rural area where the inhabitants devote themselves primarily to agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

He sells general groceries like sugar, rice, cooking oil, and noodles, among other products.  He has experience in the business, and he has very good personal and work references in the area.

He will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for his business.  By doing this Britaldo is looking to increase the stock of products in his store in order to be able to satisfy the tastes and preferences of his customers.  This investment will allow him to have greater earnings in order to improve his financial situation and, therefore, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Cristina Jaquelina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera. Vive con sus dos hijos en casa familiar en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en el distrito son la agricultura y la ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 03 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Además se dedica a realizar trabajos en computadora como escaneos e impresiones, generando ingresos adicionales que le permitirán solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio, con esto Cristina espera satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo cual tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina, age 30, is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in the family house in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  The main business activities that are carried out in the district are agriculture and livestock.

She sells groceries like rice, sugar, and cooking oil, among others.  Her business is located at her house.  She has three years of experience in this type of work, and she has very good personal and work references in the area.  She also does computer jobs like scanning and printing.  This generates additional income that allows her to repay the loan without any problem.

The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of products for her business.  With this Cristina hopes to satisfy the tastes and needs of her customers.  This will have a positive impact on her level of income and, therefore, her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products for her business.

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en:
Chheun is 41 years old, a married farmer with seven children who lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for 14 years. Her husband is a 50-year-old retired soldier. Among all the children, three of them are factory workers, one has an electric generator for rent and three are students. They can make around USD 22 each day. 

Chheun has decided to take a loan to buy two oxen for plowing. This loan will help her reduce the plowing expenses. In the future, she hopes to build a new house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy two oxen for plowing.

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Victoria, tiene  42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad  y la menor tiene 14 años, estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Victoria es una mujer muy trabajadora   que le gusta ganar lo suyo realizando una labor que le encanta la cual es cocinar, ella tiene un negocio de venta de ceviches y encebollados en un local arrienda en el mercado de la localidad, su local  el cual es muy visitado tanto por comerciantes del lugar o  personas que llegan a realizar sus compras, ella trabaja 5 días por semana con la ayuda de su familia, ya son más de 12 años que lleva preparando estos platos los cuales son el deleite de su distinguida clientela.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado,  yuca, sodas y otros ingredientes necesarios para preparar los platos. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora su negocio.  Sus sueños son darle una buena educación a su hija menor.
texts.en:
In the 24 De Mayo canton, Manabí province, known for its lovely landscape, for its forests, variety of fauna and for its friendly and hard-working people who work in agriculture and animal husbandry, the Madre Para un Futuro Mejor communal bank group meets every two weeks. 

Victoria lives in this place. She is 42 years old, married, and from this relationship has 3 children, two are adults and the younger one is 14 years old, studies in secondary school, and is the one who still lives with them. Her husband is in sales. 

Victoria is a very hard-working woman who likes to earn her own money, doing work that she loves, which is cooking. She has a business selling ceviches [seafood dishes] and encebollados [onion based dishes] in a rented stall at the market in her locality. Her stall is very popular with the businesspeople of the place or people who come to do their shopping. She works 5 days per week with the help of her family. She has been preparing these dishes, which are a delight for her distinguished customers, for more than 12 years.

This loan is to purchase fish, yucca, soda and other ingredients necessary to make her dishes. She is a founding member of the communal bank group and she likes it because, with the loans, she improves her business. Her dream is to provide her youngest daughter with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase fish, yucca, soda and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
Marino tiene 37 años de edad, es casado. Su familia es unida, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Este distrito se dedica básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimor, cuenta con un terreno agrícola propio donde esta ubicada su parcela de café. Tiene experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente Marino se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de productos como abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Con esto Marino espera mejorar la calidad de su producción para así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, incrementando sus ingresos y con esto su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marino is 37 years old and married. His family is united, he lives with his wife and three children in his own traditionally-built home in the Santo Tomas district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. This district is known for its farming and cattle.

He grows the Catimor variety of coffee. He has his own farmland where his coffee parcel is located. He has experience growing coffee and has very good personal and work references from the area. In addition, Marino raises and sells cattle. The loan will be used to buy products such as manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop. With this Marino hopes to improve the quality of his product and in this way satisfy the needs of his customers, increasing his income and thus his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy products such as manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: Luz es una emprendedora mujer de 39 años de edad,  ella inició su negocio de salón de belleza gracias a la herencia familiar que le dejo su tía con quien trabajó por muchos años en este negocio, años después decidió realizar estudios de belleza para especializarse en este oficio,  una vez finalizado sus estudios, con sus propios ahorros compro los activos fijos y empezó a prestar sus servicios.  Actualmente el negocio tiene 1 año de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada por el excelente servicio.  Luz tiene una amplia gama de servicios para el cuidado del cabello, masajes capilares, cortes de cabello, aplicación de tintes, blower entre otros.  Sus principales clientes son los vecinos y amigos, a quienes atiende en un horario laboral de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m. desde lunes a domingo. Sus compras de productos capilares, las realiza a proveedores especializados y las cancela de contado, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual hará adecuaciones del local para obtener un permiso de bioseguridad, esta inversión permitirá que continúe ejerciendo sus labores. Luz es madre una hija de 14 años y un hijo de 19 años, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro, por ello su meta familiar es ofrecerles estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Luz is an enterprising woman, 39 years old. She began her beauty salon business thanks to a family inheritance which her aunt left her, with whom she worked for many years in this business. Later, she decided to go to beauty school to specialize in this trade. Once finished with her studies, with her own savings she bought the fixed assets and began to offer her services. Currently, the business has been operating for 1 year and has a loyal customer base due to her excellent service. 

Luz has a wide range of services to care for the hair, head massages, haircuts, dyes, and blow-drying, among others. Her primary customers are neighbors and friends, who she serves during a work schedule of 8 am to 8 pm from Monday to Sunday. She makes her purchases of hair products from specialized providers and pays in cash. 

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Domingo, with which she will make improvements to the space to get a biosafety permit. This investment will allow her to continue doing her work. Luz is the mother of a 14-year-old daughter and a 19-year-old son, to whom she wants to offer a better future, for this reason, her family goal is to offer them a university education.

loans.use: to make improvements to the space to get a biosafety permit.

loans.name: Flor De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Reina, tiene 22 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con sus padres en una aldea del Municipio de la Iguala, Lempira. Reina logro terminar sus estudios primarios y siempre ha trabajado en la agricultura junto a sus padres. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café, el cual vende en grano en la misma zona. Decidió solicitar otro prestamo por 6,000 Lempiras, siendo el segundo ciclo en la institución, con el cual va comprar foliares, abonos y pago de mano de obra para mejorar la finca de café. Su sueño es seguir estudiando, formar una familia y crecer con el cultivo de café para llegar a ser una de las productoras fuertes de la zona. 
Este prestamo es en forma grupal, que se llama Flor de Octubre, integrado por dos personas que viven en la misma zona y tienen cultivo de café. Han solicitado un monto total por 12,000 lempiras para fertilizar y limpiar la finca de café. En la foto a la izquierda esta Reina y a la derecha esta Eufracio.
texts.en:
Reina is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in a town in the Municipality of Iguala, Lempira. Reina managed to finish her primary school education and has always worked in agriculture with her parents. She has 4 years of experience growing coffee, which she sells as a bean in the same zone. She decided to ask for another loan of 6,000 lempiras, in her second loan cycle with the institution, with which she will purchase fertilizer to be applied to the leaves, manure, and pay labor costs to to improve her coffee plantation. Her dream is to continue studying, form a family and grow with the coffee crop to become one of the strongest producers in the zone.

This loan is in the form of a group, which is called Flor de Octobre, made up of two people who live in the same zone and have coffee crops. They have asked for a total amount of 12,000 lempiras to fertilize and clean the coffee plantation. In the photo, Reina is on the left and Eufracio is on the right.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer which will be applied to the leaves, manure, and pay labor costs to help with the coffee crop.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro tiene 47 años de edad, es casado. Vive con su cónyuge en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades básicas que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con 06 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la temporada de cosecha. Con esto Teodoro espera mejorar la calidad de su producto para poder ofrecer una mejor cosecha a sus clientes, aumentando su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 47 years old and married. He lives with his wife in their own rustic home, which is located in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern highlands of Peru. Farming and cattle raising are the core economic activities in this district. 

He makes a living in farming, specifically growing coffee beans. He has six years of experience in this field. He has very good personal and work references in the area. 

He will use the loan to buy phytosanitary products, and inorganic and organic fertilizers to maintain his crops as well as to pay for labor for the harvest season. 

With this, Teodoro hopes to improve the quality of his product in order to offer a better harvest to his customers. In this way, he will increase his income and, as a result, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy inorganic and organic fertilizers to maintain his crops as well as to pay for labor.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. For more than three years, she has run a small sari-sari (convenience store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. 

Elvira is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as canned goods, rice, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, snack foods, etc. to sell. This loan will help Elvira to improve her store’s sales and profit. In the future, Elvira hopes to make her business more stable and to generate more revenue. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, rice, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, snack foods, etc. to sell
